"This anime is definitely a romantic school comedy," says Tamaki Suoh. I would have to agree, that description is right on target. I think the best way to describe this anime is bubbly, humorous, and off-the-top adorable. Although this is not necessarily intended to be suspenseful, the very first episode has the viewer pulled in and left waiting to see what events unfold for the mysterious scholarship student. I will admit the plot line is far from boring and the characters make you want to root for them. However, if it wasn't for the diversity in the host club's' personalities the plot line wouldn't havestood a chance at being this successful. Each character did a phenomenal job at portraying a different personality extreme and for that you really see how the characters develop and change throughout the course of the show. Honestly, how many other animes have twins with homosexual tendencies? Not many, and that is just another reason why Ouran High School Host Club surprises you with it's originality and specific situations in each proceeding episode.


I highly recommend this anime and I highly recommend an open mind (due to suggestive themes) while watching.

Story: 8
This is the weakest point of the show, not that it's bad, but because it really isn't centered on it. When it is put front and center it almost feels like filler after watching 17 episodes of solid laughs. The plot nevertheless is carried out beautifully and helps you feel a personal connection to each of the characters.
Art: 8
This show probably has some of the best drawing I have ever seen. The movements of the characters are very fluid and... uh... beautiful, considering their men and, uh, yeah... The backgrounds are well drawn, not really spectacular but after all, it's a PINK highschool. Ido appreciate how they centered more attention on the character animation and there are next to no still screens.


Sound: 9

The voice acting was frankly perfect. All the characters were well matched with their actors in the dub (and what I've heard of the sub is really amazing too).  Almost the entire English cast if from Fullmetal Alchemist, which can be very disconcerting.  The background music is classical and light hearted, but when needed there are some great drama pieces.  I personally like the intro song, it fits the anime well in my opinion, and it's very catchy, so catchy I sang it accidently, in public, in a supermarket.  My sister wouldn't acknowledge me for a while after that.


Character: 10

This show does good where it counts. Everyone who views this will probably have at least one of the hosts on their favourites list. Each host represents a highschool stereotype but stretch beyond it each in their own way.  My personal favourites are Haruhi Fujioka and Tamaki Suoh.  Haruhi is serious and NOTHING phases her, really nothing.  Tamaki is hilarious and is frequently at the brunt end of jokes. Outside of the hosts the secondary characters are fairly well done, even the Lobelia girls despite the fact that I greatly dislike them, you might even be able to say that I HATE them.


Overall: 9

This is an excellent shoujo, and it is probably the most shoujo anime I have ever seen, or will see. Guys may feel a bit intimidated about watching it and might not make it past the intro. (Hint: Roses, so many roses!) However it is so very worth your while if you give it a chance. Ouran High School Host Club is available for legal viewing at youtube.com/shows and dvds are sold in America.


Parent's Caution:

This show is for teens as it has copious amounts of fanservice, though largely without immodesty and most of the fanservice is shirtless men... if that is any consolation.

-There is implied homosexuality, but it is merely for the entertainment of the female patrons of the club, again if that is any consolation.

-Also there are lesbians and crossdressers, both used for comedic reasons.

-There is little to no swearing and no sex scenes (I promise there's none no matter how many times you think there will be.)

-The comedy never stoops to crude and this show is far more appropriate then the vast majority of teen dramas and comedies State-side.

This is only my second review, and my first one wasn't that great so please forgive me if it's awful.  So... Ouran High School Host Club... it's about 1 o'clock in the morning and I just finished it and I couldn't be happier.
The Story 
The story didn't have really a beginning and an end as much as it had a pattern that slowly moved the series forward (as much as it repeats, it does move forward).  I grew to love the pattern, seeing the new outfits, how much trouble the Host Club would cause for Haruhi, and what lesson everyone would learn fromthe dim witted but laughably noble and kind hearted Tamaki (who has now become one of my all time favorite characters!).  Also, the ending was almost perfect, they had me wondering how it would end a few times, but they did not disappoint me like so many other animes.


The Art

The art wasn't supper amazing, but it fit this particular anime's personality well.  The show has some serious under tones, but is mostly fun and games.  The art reflected that by staying clean (clean in a sense of minimal details) and modest (especially for a romance genre).  But there were also times when more detailing was used, which I felt were appropriate and did not take away from what was happening.


The Sound

I'm not all together sure why they have a sound section... I guess some anime's might have particularly fun music worth commenting on but, any how... I guess now that I think about it there are some things to write about.  The opening song is really catchy, and it helps that the chorus is english... you'll be getting it stuck in your head a lot.  AND, Tamaki plays the piano exquisitely *fan girl drools* I love a guy that's musically inclined :-)


The Characters 

If I could have a reverse harem, it would have every member of the Host Club in it :-}  Like I said, Tamaki was really entertaining, he was probably drawn in some comical way (like the sad lookin guys with the circles for eyes and no coloring) more often then not.  I also really liked Honey, he was really cute.  This anime also took good care to fully explain all the major characters, at times this part was kind of depressing, especially the twins, but it just helped add to the finale.  Also, once you start watching you may notice all the different groups of people with ambiguous sexual orientations... that part of the show surprised me a little.  It was pretty adult content for what seemed to be a younger age anime... but hey I could be wrong.  I thought it was interesting how they explored the idea of how gender shouldn't make a difference in how you live you life and treat others.  Even though they conveyed it with semi-adult content, they got a across a pretty fundamental life lesson.


Enjoyment!!

Ouran High School Host Club gets a 10/10 for enjoyment!  I was laughing the entire time.  There was a serious story going on with life lessons being learned and all but mostly it was just screamingly funny!  I'm used to watching shounen type animes with lots of action, and blood, and really thick tragic drama.  This was a really good change of pace for me and I am happy to say that I have successfully broadened my taste in anime because of it.


Overall Ouran gets a 10/10, there were some parts that might have been improved upon but only just a little, in fact I may not have liked it so much if they'd changed anything about it.  I highly recommend you watch this anime, it's funny and cute and heart warming.  GO... WATCH!


KP

Ouran Host Club has almost everything I look for in an anime - romance, drama, reverse harem, beautiful art and "bimbo" guy characters (don't take it personally, I just love these entertaining things). I actually hoped for a more HE for Tama-chan and Haru-chan (a kiss maybe haha) but it was also nice in a way that their friendship was perfectly conserved.

Ouran high school host club is very much a shojo slice of life anime. Haruhi Fujioka is a schlorship student at a very prestigious school. After a uniform mix up she has to wear the boys uniform on her first day. She stumbles upon the Ouran academy’s host club. Where charming young men dazzle young ladies. Haruhi accidentally knocks over an extremely valuable vase that was meant to be auctioned off. As haruhi has no way of repaying the vase the host club “employs” her thinking she is male as a host. She is very good at being a host as she is able torelate to the girls. Each member of the host club gradually discovers she is a girl and they help her keep it a secret (so she can continue to work at the host club and pay off her debt).


This anime has so many cute and funny moments. It is a well loved anime for good reason. Great characters, great humour, average story. Okay so it isn’t that original the whole “girl surrounded by a heap of guys and she has to try to not be discovered”. There are quite a few similar story lines out there. The thing that is great about Ouran high school host club is that it is very approachable. You don’t need really any prior knowledge to anime or anything to understand it. It is one of those anime that introduces a lot of people to anime. I think it is overall a fun anime. There is a very big following and their is so many different “shipping” of the characters. It is definitely romance based without being direct about it. It doesn’t really make a lot of sense but if you watch it you will understand what I mean.


The characters are great and I love Haruhi. She is a great female protagonist and she is very strong and independent. The guys are sometimes over protective and it is super cute. This anime is another one that is over the top exaggerated and generally is random. To sum up Ouran high school host club I would say cute. It is funny and despite not having a very good over arcing plot each episode has a nice pace. I would recommend this anime to you if it sounds like something you would be interested in.

I didn't plan to watch this ever because the art seemed so unappealing and it's so very popular therefore I was sure I would hate it. It's one of my favourite shows now.
Story 10/10: It doesn't really have an overarching plot line, and it is very much episodic, which is a setup I  tend to struggle with, but here it works so well, as thanks to the different situations the characters are thrown in each episode, they have ample time and space to be fleshed out and to grow. 
Art 10/10: It doesn't look as good as some new shows but honestly the artstyle and colours especially really worked in the show's favour, contributing to the very light hearted atmosphere. The animation was very fluid, and there was some outstanding moments, such as playing with the lighting to show a particular character's feelings and such things. Overall I found no glaring issues in this department.


Sound 10/10: The opening is a classic, you can't help but love it, but I didn't much care for the ending theme, unfortunately. I really liked the background music though, it is quite exaggerated sometimes and uses a lot of violin and piano, which really contributes to the atmosphere of the show. The voice acting however, is outstanding, from the main characters to the side characters, and especially during the gag scenes. 


Character 10/10: Apart from the comedy, this show's strength lies in its characters. Everyone in the main cast is initially set up to be the representation of a stereotype, but then the show goes on and focuses on each of them, and basically flips the stereotypes on their heads. It's really quite amazing how much of a difference there is between their personalities and their relationships in the first episode and in the last episode. There are quite a lot of side-characters introduced but somehow it never feels like the show focuses too much on them, actually it's more like the main cast is developed through  their interactions with the side characters. The characters really exceeded my expectations, as I was sure I would hate some of them before I watched it, but now the entire main cast has found a special place on my list of favourite characters ever.


Enjoyment 10/10: I have a love-hate relationship with comedy series that are episodic, because the jokes rarely work on me, but here they worked too well. There wasn't a single episode apart from the more serious ones that didn't make me laugh out loud at least four times, which never happens. There was this particular episode that had the banana gag like 7 times and it still managed to be funny every time. I have no idea how they did it, but this is how comedy should be done. And even though it is episodic, that didn't stop me from binging it in three days, which, again, never happens with such shows. 


Overall 10/10: It is over-the-top and ridiculous, but one of the most fun anime I've ever had the pleasure of watching, and I wouldn't want anyone to miss out on that. I wouldn't exactly recommend this if you're searching for a great romance though, the manga does a lot better in that department.

Oh boy this show was an experience.  It in many ways is awful and yet it keeps you engaged because of how purely enjoyable it is.  There are many hilarious lines, outrages scenes, and overall it’s a ride. I watched the entire anime in a two day span and loved it.  It’s hard to tell if this show is amazingly woke or boarderline offensive, but regardless it’s an experience. I’ll go through each eating and explain them down below:
Story 3: Perhaps giving the story a three is being too harsh.  The storyline isn’t all that great if you looked at itfrom a far. It’s not that it’s an awful storyline because it was indeed enjoyable to follow, but the development and plot of the anime was pretty poor.\n
Art 5: The art style is pretty dated.  It’s not bad for the time period it’s coming for and I don’t mind its stylistic choices, but it’s definitely dated.  Overall though, I think it works for the anime. \n
Sound 7: I’ve seen it both subbed and dubbed and in both cases the voice acting was good.  I’m not normally a big dubbed fan, but they got some good actors to come in and the performances were nice. \n
Character 5 (nope 6): I’m a bit sad giving this one a 5.  I love the characters, but most of them are relatively insane and off the wall.  However, with that said, the anime did do a great job developing their characters.  You know what, never mind I’m changing this score to a 6 now that I think of the care the creators took in character development. \n
Enjoyability 10: This was the easiest score to give.  Thanks to all the problems in the storyline and awkwardness and ridiculousness, this show is hilarious and very enjoyable to watch. \n
Overall 9; I’m not giving it a 9 overall because the anime is great, I’m giving it a 9 because the experience is great. \n

'Ouran High School Host Club' is definitely more than meets the eye. Yes, all of the characters are designated some sort of a stereotype that they live up to, but the situations they are forced into satirises the many stereotypes and tropes that plague many rom-com, slice-of-life shoujo animes. (+2 for cutting edge satire and a witty delivery).
Story:
The plot of Ouran, itself, is pretty much absent and the show relies heavily on problem-of-the-week scenarios which are funny - at first - but do eventually become tiresome (-1 for lack of proper plot progression). But the shows real charm isn't its plot - or lack of- its the manner in which it's executed that makes it so charming: the scenarios are often mocking the moe and fangirl aspects of shoujo. (+2 for saving a dismal plot with wit and sarcasm). The show doesn't seem to suffer much from bad pacing, except in the last two episodes where we don't get some sort of a plot; however, everything felt a little bit rushed and muddled (-1 for making me confused) and the ending did fall into that shoujo trope of leaving the viewer quite disappointed (-1). Nonetheless, poking fun at the typical fairy-tale endings of shoujo (by having Haruhi dancing around with her harem of men) was pretty funny (+1). Furthermore, despite its Harem setting, Haruhi never finds herself being torn between multiple guys! (+1)


Characters:


Ouran's heroine, Haruhi, is presented as an intelligent girl who doesn't care about gender confinements or her looks. The most important part of her character is that she's intelligent - unlike most Shoujos, Haruhi is not only said to be smart, but she actually IS smart (+1). Its great to see her break the fourth wall and make some snarky remark about the other characters (especially when it comes to Tamaki). She's witty, sharp and snarky and I just LOVE her (+1).


The members of the Host Club are, unfortunately, not as appealing to me as Haruhi.  Half of them fail to do much outside of the stereotype that they are assigned to - which is where the anime falls flat (-1). Tamaki is funny, but that's about it. I didn't really feel much from him, and the sob story near the end didn't convince me. He was just your typical shoujo 'Prince'. Honey-senpai (and the irrelevant mute: Mori-senpai) was really annoying; I can't stand loli-shota characters, and Honey reminded me why: they're so babyish and never care about anything except the things that please them. I think the anime would have been better without such a character (-1). However, the Hitachiin twins - who are initially presented as two incestous brothers - do well to work out of their stereotype. Despite looking the same, the two have very different personalities: Kaouru is the wise and kind one, whilst Hikaru is the rash and rebellious one. Their development was probably the most surprising, and I think that they two ended up growing the most out of all of the Host Club members (sans Haruhi) (+2 for development and variety). Of course, I have to mention Ootori Kyouya - who has become one of my favourite male characters. The guy is just so calm, calculative and cunning. Perceptive and evil without remorse: he's always one step ahead of everybody else (+1). His humour his dry, but always manages to burn (+1) and he never tries to make himself appear as anything other than a pragmatic, money-loving genius (+1). That being said, he does have his flaws: his sob story is boring and I have absolutely no sympathy with him being the third son and having to "live up" to so much. His sense of entitlement does bother me, and he could do without some of his snobbiness (-1). 



Art and Sound:


To be honest, the art Ouran is ugly to me. The colouring is pretty, but the actual aesthetics of the characters are bleh. Everybody seems to have really long limbs and huge hands, and their heads never seem to match their bodies. I didn't find the art attractive at all (-2). 


However, the animators did a good job at conveying the expressions of the characters which went well with the scenarios and feelings the characters were dealing with. Even the stoic Mori got a chance to show some facial variety (+1).


The seiyuus did their jobs really well! Although I watch anime with subs, I felt the changes in pitch and phrasing depending on the emotions that were being presented at the time. (+1). The use of classical music was nice, too, and I feel that it complemented the high-class setting of Ouran very well. However, the repetitive use of some pieces became quite annoying so the overall sound gets a (0) from me.


Overall and enjoyment:


Despite its many flaws, I did really enjoy Ouran. It was a great piece of entertainment and is a perfect light-watch. There's drama, but its nothing too intense (especially after having binge-watched both seasons of Psycho-Pass prior to watching Ouran). The humour is the heart of this show: I don't think there are many shoujos that are as satirical as Ouran. I love satire, and I especially loved the constant mocking of moe, otakus, otomes, fangirls and shoujo tropes.  (+1 for enjoyment and humour). Therefore, I recommend Ouran to those who are like for an entertaining watch that also offers a refreshing take on the shoujo genre.


Overall score: 7/10.

I had a lot of fun with this show, that is all I could simply say. This show had been enjoyable and... holy shit it's 4:23 am I'm tired as shit fuck this formal bullshit this show was great. This show had gone deeper into the plot in more ways I had expected. And to finally see this show ending, it's almost painful. It's as painful and grueling like a daughter marrying another man, as Tamaki might say.
This show is really playful and jokes around a lot, but at the same time incorporated deeper aspects to it. It feels like it can juggle all thataround almost perfectly. It felt like there was a very nice balance, and it had executed the show perfectly. You know what you're going to get and it executes and delivers perfectly.


The way this show executed their actions, the way the plot had dove into the characters more so than you could expect. I'd personally say on a 4:27 am ramble of anime talk that this was its strong point of this show. It wasn't the classic romcom that had this whole set-up of interesting characters, that all had interesting stories but never dove into it, leaving it as a generic surface potential of fat hump. It had a good set-up, a good plot, enjoyable and intriguing characters, a good development of the show and the characters, and shows you how everything got started from the beginning. Showing you that not every finished product doesn't have a story behind it. It's the story behind how the host club was made that is what makes the show unique and special.


This show had stayed consistent and fluid. They were very natural with their execution, like how it should be placed. Everything felt as though it happened for a good and logical reason that most everyone can agree with. Nothing seemed irrational or out of place. It seemed right, the characters stayed who they're supposed to be like as if they were real people, there was no fluctuation of irrational emotions without being explained as to why it happened. It all felt reasonable and within boundaries.


Despite everything I had said, I want to point out the major flaw of this show. That is is that it lacks a focus, it feels as though there is no main story to this. It only gets fairly serious towards the end of the show, it feel more so like random painted colors that are enjoyed individually onto a big blank canvas. But when you take a step back, you realize that it's nothing much but pretty colors put together capriciously. However true it may be that the characters had much development, doesn't change the fact that this show had no focus and was very hard to put up with at some points. It was a simple and fun show that was meant to be taken without much thought or seriousness put into it. If you are looking for a show that is simple and enjoyable, this would definitely be something that you should watch.

I have to admit, shoujo anime  are something that I'm always very hesitant about, the fact that nowadays, they don't seem to have much original concepts, is only one of the many reason why I'm reluctant to place them carefully in my anime schedule.
Ouran was not one of those.
It's probably because I wasn't very knowledgeable on anime when I first watched Ouran High school Host Club. But it was also because I was drawn into something that I know people will find cliché at first, but trust me dear, a few more episodes, and you'll find yourself crying silently alone at 4am in themorning. 


So lets dig in.


Story: 10/10


Our story starts off with our dear Haruhi Fujioka, an innocent girl who just happens to be in a prestigious school called Ouran Academy. Basically somewhere rich people drop their rich kids off, and hope that they learn something. Haruhi is not the typical student, as she is a commoner, who has outstanding grades, and eventually got a scholarship. She stumbles upon an abandoned music room where she will eventually find people that she'll later on regret finding.


An idiot, 2 more idiots. The loli, quiet guy, and very, very manipulating douche.


And this is the part where she just so happens to break 3 million yen vase and very, very, manipulating douche, makes her pay off her debt by working for the host club.


I also forgot to mention that she is in fact dressed as guy.


I hate it. I hate how this show made me love these idiots. I hate how this show made me cry because of these idiots. And I hate that very, very manipulating douche, who made me not hate him.


The story is somewhat tragic, I know they are portrayed as rich and all, but the host club has people with different stories that the viewer might relate to. I found very, very manipulating douche's story similar to my own.


I do find that around the end, the story makes up a last minutes plot twist, which I had expected. But I didn't care since the stories before the last minute twist had left me bawling my eyes out so really, I was still emotionally effected by the time the twist occurred.


You soon gradually love how the pieces form a puzzle for the host club, how the members were intertwined and how this one idiot made a club.


The story is hilarious, the characters are hilarious. Even I have to admit I had viewed this as a very easy-going show until it starts torturing my heart. You'll fail to pass it off as just another harem, because it isn't. If you need proof just look at all the damages to my heart and internal organs. 


It's all their fault.


I found the story enjoyable and heart-wrenching.


Art: 8/10


Roses are flying everywhere. That is all.


Sound: 9/10


I was pleasantly surprised at the music, the nice, light, orchestral, classical music for the theme of the host club that you'll hear every once in a while is very relaxing. The theme song is just..


Meh.


I mean, it's not bad, it's just not good either. 

I did watch the English Dub.


English Dubs are something I know a lot are reluctant about, but the casting is great. The voices fit perfectly. It's just perfect, I even liked Rengi's voice actor. It's great. I watched the sub, and to be honest, I find both good. It's up to personal preference, but for now, I recommend both really.


Character: 10/10


Find out for yourself. I'AM NOT WRITING SOMETHING THAT I KNOW IS GOING TO MAKE ME CRY, OKAY?


Enjoyment: 10/10


I'm just going to say that I found myself in a black hole once I finished. Desperately searching for a second season. I loved this anime, the character development is beautiful. You'll see what they've gone through in the past, and it's beautiful. It really is. Especially that manipulating douche's story (reason why I was found isolating myself for a week after an emotional breakdown at 4am)


Overall: 10/10


Did I enjoy something that seemed ridiculous? Yeah


Did I enjoy a lot of idiots doing idiotic things? Yeah


Did I enjoy crying at 4am after watching this show? Yeah


Is this show going to put you in an emotional mental state after you watch it?


Well, yeah.

"The Ouran host club is where the school's handsomest boys with way too much time on their hands, entertain young ladies who also have way too much time on their hands. Just think of it as Ouran's elegant playground for the super rich and beautiful."-Tamaki Suoh
This show is just pure fun and nostalgia to me. It was one of the first anime I had watched. I remember when I only watched a few anime before this one. Examples being Fullmetal Alchemist, Fruits Basket, and Naruto. I have watched this anime multiple times and it still makes me rolling on the floor laughing. From the randomthings the characters would say, the quirky and wacky situations, and just the characters themselves. It's not just plain comedy, it does have its serious and dramatic moments. Don't go into this anime and expect tons of sad moments. These moments don't really happen that often and when they do, they're really short, but if you're wanting to have a good laugh and maybe with friends, this is the perfect show to check out. I really like good romantic comedy anime with good characters, so this was the perfect anime for me back then. I'll try to put my nostalgia aside and give it the proper review it deserves, now shall we get to the review?


Story 8/10 Standout(s) The wacky and funny situations


If you're expecting a deep and dramatic story, this isn't the best anime for you. In my opinion, you don't need a deep story to make a good show. Sometimes you just need good characters and fun situations for the characters to play off of. Does Ouran have those elements? Yes it does for me. I'll get to the characters later, for the funny moments they were hilarious. I was rolling on the floor laughing so hard. There was one time where we got to see Haruhi's dad, I won't tell you how it went but that was so out of place and comes out of nowhere that I just had to laugh. The drama was very effective and got you in the feels box. My only problem with the drama was that it didn't last that long, mostly 1-2 minutes. I'd love to see it go on for longer, maybe 7-8 minutes. Since we're talking about flaws, let's talk about the ending. It's one of those "Go buy the manga to continue the story" types of endings. Even though there were some touching moments in that end, I still didn't find the ending that satisfying. My last flaw was that it kind of have some cliches of shoujo anime. One being the main character's mom passing away. Well despite its flaws, I still enjoyed the story in OHSHC.


Positives in the story: The balance of comedy and drama

Negatives in the story: The ending, shoujo cliches, and the dramatic moments not being long enough.


Art and Animation 10/10 Standout(s) The animation


This was done by Studio Bones, who also did Fullmetal Alchemist and Soul Eater. If you've seen those anime, you'd know how great the art and animation is. Just by looking at it, you could tell this was a shoujo anime. I love how vivid and elegant the art and animation was. It wasn't too bright and not too dark. It was just perfect for this anime. The character designs were very unique and had their own personality to them. You can tell the difference between characters by their body, hair, and faces. It wasn't that traditional same character with different color eyes and hair thing. The animation was used effectively. There was recycled animation in some scenes, like the Renge gangs. It was used as a gang, and it works really well for the show. Overall, great art and animation score.


Positives in the Art and Animation: Vivid art, unique character designs, and beautiful animation.

Negatives in the Art and Animation: None


Sound 9/10 Standout(s) The dub


Soundtrack:


I loved the soundtrack a lot. I loved a lot of the violin pieces that were in the background. I thought they fitted in with the atmosphere and tone of the show. Before I move onto the opening, I want to give a shout out to the character themes. My personal favorite being Tamaki's theme. I thought it really fit his character and sounded very cute. Now let's talk about the opening.


Opening:


The opening really fit the upbeat atmosphere the show gave off. I honestly loved the opening in Japanese. The English in my opinion, didn't really sound as good. The English version was okay, but it lacked the passion that Japanese version had.


Dub:


Since this is a Funamtion dub, of course it's very well done. Since this show has a lot of Japanese culture in, it must have been hard for these actors to pronounce all these Japanese words. Not only did they get the pronunciation right, but they also fit the characters that they were given. My favorite, of course was Vic Mignogna as Tamaki. I think that this one of his best performances since Ed from FMA. He fit the weird and attractive guy that Tamaki was. Overall, excellent dub.


Positives in the Sound: Elegant soundtrack, fun opening, and well acted dub.

Negatives in the Sound: The English version of the opening.


Characters 10/10 Standout(s) The 7 main characters


All of the characters were unique, complex, and had some development. Maybe after I'm done reading the manga, I'll review the rest of the characters. For now let's talk about Haruhi and Tamaki.


Haruhi:


Haruhi isn't just your typical love interest in a reverse harem. While most reverse harem anime have their main character very cute and kind, (Tohru Honda from Fruits Basket for example.) Haruhi is more independent, tomboyish, and keeps to herself then most other love interests. This makes her more unique and deeper then most other main love interests. She's in this kind of stage until we learn her back story and her fears. She fears being alone and lightning. This way, the audience gets a better understanding of her strengths and weaknesses. This also makes her more human and more understandable then most other characters in romantic comedy anime. Now for Tamaki.


Tamaki:


Honestly my favorite character in the whole series. Tamaki may seem like the stereotypical rich guy and comic relief, but he has more of a heart then that. He's the "king" of the host club and is the fonder of it. He will help out anyone in need of it and will protect them from all harm. He also has a little bit of a sensitive side that he normally doesn't show. He hides his emotions by being happy and positive about things. He will be serious when the time is right. To me, Tamaki is the "prince charming" of anime. His life goal is to make everyone happy and he puts others before himself. He definitely had the development he needed and the perfect personality. Definitely a brilliant character that added a lot to the show and manga.


Positives about the characters: Deep, fun, and realistic characters

Negatives about the characters: None


Enjoyment: 9/10


People who will love this: Shoujo and Reverse harem fans, comedy fans, and otaku's in general

People who won't like this: Fans of fast pasted action anime and People who like darker anime


Overall: 9.00/10


Positives: Funny story, Beautiful art and animation, Elegant soundtrack, fun opening, good dub, and deep and emotional characters.


Negatives: The end, not long enough dramatic moments, Shoujo cliches, and the English opening


This was a fantastic anime that should be watched by shoujo lovers. It was very funny and lovable show. It's a show that's going to make you laugh out loud and have a fun time. I've watched this millions of times and I'll watch it a million more. Well, that's it for the review! I hope you enjoyed!

While I'm not a real connoisseur of anime and don't watch a lot of it compared to most users on MAL, I think many of us who have seen Ouran High School Host Club can say that is definitely one of the most unique series out there.  It's an enjoyable, lighthearted series to watch that definitely deserves the attention it receives.  If you're looking for fan service, romance, comedy, a nice story, and character development, this anime caters to all four.
Story - 8/10
Ouran starts out like many otome games (which is ironic seeing as it has an adaptation out for the DS now)where a girl is somehow roped into spending her time with a bunch of guys through a series of coincidences.  Our main heroine, Haruhi Fujioka, is not only a fish out of water in this regard but also due to the fact that she's a scholarship student attending a prestigious school for the wealthy.  With this setup you'd expect for these outside rich kids to be pretty shallow characters.  At first, you're right and it's funny to see their ostentatious and exaggerated personalities.  However, as you progress you start to learn more about the characters and their quirks.  The anime does a fantastic job of letting you get to know everyone in a fluid way (as opposed to character arcs) while preserving the comedy.  It's easy to get attached to all of them.  My one complaint is that the romance is underdeveloped.  If you're pitching for Haruhi to get together with one of the other hosts (you probably will the way the story is told) you're more than likely going to end up disappointed.  The manga does a better job with this, but the anime still is still a great story on its own.


Art - 7/10

I've never been one to judge an anime based on its art or animation unless it's almost outrageous like Kanon 2002.  If I had anything to say, the art has a certain appeal to it that's either a hit or miss with viewers.  It's certainly very pink and shiny a lot of the time, but there are some episodes where the flamboyancy is taken out and you feel refreshed.


Sound - 7/10

The opening is very sweet and sugary.  It's fun to sing along to, but the ending is just plain great.  You'd think Ouran wouldn't have such an intense ending given that it's a light, bubbly comedy, but the ending to me serves as a reminder that the events of the episode were more memories and experiences to help the characters grow.  What stopped me from giving this an 8/10 is that the soundtrack playing throughout the episode can be overdone and repeated at times.


Character - 10/10

This is where Ouran shines for me.  It takes so many archetypes and contradicts them for comedic purposes.  It's pretty funny, and it doesn't get 10 stars from me for only this reason.  Some characters are admirable, some are laughable, but all of them are lovable.  They all have compelling, sound backstories and you feel for them.  Even side characters or recurring background characters are interesting to get to know.  What Ouran does so well and what makes the underdeveloped romance so frustrating is how much it builds on the relationships between the characters - and not just the MC's relationship with each host.  You start seeing them as lovable goofballs who work so well as a group that it's hard to see them without each other, which pulls you in even further to the anime.  Hikaru is my personal favorite.


Enjoyment - 9/10

Whether it be for what antics they'll get into next or what's going to happen between the characters, Ouran is a series that keeps you coming back for more.  It's a very enjoyable series to watch because it's not entirely episodic but not entirely plot-driven.  You watch their journey, laughing throughout the way and getting your heartstrings tugged at.  The characters are memorable and they do what they do well.  I highly recommend it if you're a new to watching anime or if you're simply looking for an enjoyable, happy series to watch.


Overall - 8/10


This is my first review, so if you have any constructive criticism I'd appreciate it if you left me a comment (in a gentle manner as I'm a sensitive person). :)

*Warning: This contains spoilers*
Story: Ouran High School Host Club was the first anime I ever completed watching. I was bored with reading the manga, so I decided to watch all 26 episodes in (I think) a week. Heck, the first I ever heard of this is when my little sister was watching it. Anyway, she recommended it to me because it was about a girl being forced to work as a boy for a host club in her private high school and all of the crazy shit she has to go through in order to repay back the damage of a vase she broke accidentally.I thought, why not? There is no why not because even though some of Ouran's episodes and adventures are cheesy (knowing that I watched the English dub doesn't make it much better), the show made it funny, very funny. Then, it did piss me when the show made it clear that Haruhi and Tamaki are supposed to be together but none of the true romantic stuff exists until the very last, fucking episode! Aaaaaaaaah! Well, I guess I know why the creators did it, and I shouldn't have any real complaints. Ouran does deliver the backstories of each character well enough to the point where I felt bad for every single one of them, even Kyoya (though I believe he's a douchebag to the max). If anything, Ouran doesn't have a straight on plot except for the fact Haruhi works at the host club just to repay her debt, which they barely talk about after the first or second episode. But still, the story wasn't the reason why I continued watching the show. For that reason, I rated it an 8 out of 10 on the story scale.


Art: This is all a part of the shojo genre. It has pink all over, the characters are cutesy, the boys are in suits, the girls are in dresses, the eyes are big, what more could you ask for? It's not like the anime had flaws in the animation because it didn't to my understanding. If you want me to be honest, I don't really pay attention to the art in animation unless it's really important. I didn't stop anything wrong in Ouran, so for that reason, it's a full vote.


Sound: If sound means background music, then that is what I'm going to base my vote on. The theme song is pretty catchy, but because I watched all 26 episodes in a very short time span, I found it annoying (like anything Selena Gomez sings), so I skipped the theme and went straight on into the show. The background music in the show itself is good. It's not like they put in music that doesn't fit to the show at all. I mean, it's a slice of life. When something is emotional, they either put an emotional score or nothing at all. When it's a very sweet moment with Haruhi and Tamaki, they put in some romantic score. Even flashback scores have music that made me tear up. I didn't pay any mind to the ending theme song either. I know when I get attached to a song. I just listen to it until it ends. When each episode ends, I just move onto the next episode and watch the interesting stuff. I guess because of how Selena Gomez the beginning theme can be, how much I don't like the ending theme and the good job the show did with the scores, I rated this section an 8 out of 10 as well.


Character: Each character has his or her own personality, and that's what I love most in anime. If the characters are Wonder Bread, I will not watch. The characters are the reason I kept watching this show til the very end. My favorite characters in this anime are (in the order of highest love and respect) Honey, the twins, and Tamaki. Honey is the most adorable person ever with a past that makes me cringe. For those who saw this already, I think you already know about Honey being forced away from desserts and cutesy stuff in order to take over the school's Karate Club, but Tamaki (being the kindest person in the world) teaches him to express himself for himself more than for anyone else in his life. You also come to learn why the twins are the way they are, and in all actuality, they are just the funniest characters in the whole series. Tamaki may be oblivious, but his heart is in the right place when it comes to Haruhi's well being in school. Remember the grocery store scene where Tamaki gets caught by Haruhi for spying on her, and he just uses the excuse her dad made when he did the same thing a longer time ago? That scene just made me fall in love with Tamaki. If there are two people I hate the most in Ouran, they are Kyoya and Renge. Kyoya is an asshole, and the only person who tries to make Haruhi's life miserable, and Renge has only importance in her first appearance, yet she still makes fucking cameos in other episodes where she's only seen once. God, her princessy attitude is so annoying. Every time I see her, she makes me want to shoot myself. I never got to explain much about Haruhi, did I? Well, her personality is almost close to Wonder Bread, but she has some things. Her purpose in Ouran is to be the character who questions her friends' motives but goes along with them because in the end they do the right things. Plus, I do feel bad that her mother passed away when she was a kid. Her father though, oh god, there are so many things I could say about him XD but I'll leave that for you to find out for yourselves. Even though she is the start of the anime, the rest doesn't not involve her as much unless it's saving her life or the boys get involved in her "commoner" lifestyle. Overall, the characters get a full vote, too.


Enjoyment: Like I said before, this anime is very funny and it makes you feel emotions you never thought to feel in a slice of life shojo. I guess the setting being a private high school for the richest people in Japan makes it a little less than slice of life, but still, it explains the lives of teenagers, which is the story that the show was intended to tell. It didn't give any false advertisements as far as I'm concerned. I cried, I laughed, I "aw"ed. There was not a boring moment whatsoever. I never had the urge to turn off my computer or anything of the sort, so in that case, 10 out of 10.


Overall: Well, I pretty much said it all. According to the official score of rounded up 8 out of 10, I highly recommend this to anime fans everywhere. Yeah, it may be mainstream as Pokemon, Naruto, One Piece, etc., but the reasons I explained created the popularity it made it out to be. For those who are not interested in mainstream, just give this a shot. You won't be disappointed.

This is a anime series which you shouldnt miss the chance to watch.
It is in shoujo genre but i think it has more than that.
Every character is hilarious and you found yourself inside the stroy, it is totally enjoyable and makes you watch more and more.
Indeed, it is a pity that there is no second season : (

"Very unexpectedly enjoyable anime!!"
This is one anime that I never expected myself to watch. My girlfriend and her girlfriends went crazy about this anime. I took one look at it, and decided it wasn't my thing. Looked like the most girl thing in the world. 
Later, I was randomly on myanimelist.net, and I bumped into this show. I took a look at the story, and it was actually kind of cool. So I downloaded the entireshow in English dubbed. It was 12:30 p.m. And I watched the first episode. It was one of the funniest things I have ever watched! It had hilarious and awesome characters, a clever story, amazing animation, and so on. After that, I watched the 2nd episode, then the 3rd, then the 4th. At that point it was pretty late in the day and I decided to only watch up to the half way point. When I got there, I couldn't stop, so I decided to watch a few more episodes. On episode 20 I said "forget it". Next thing I know it's 6 a.m and I finished the last episode.\n
It literally came out of nowhere by how much I loved it. In one day, it became my second favorite anime, (1st being DBZ). Everything about it is so cool. Not just for girls either, it's got some pretty hilarious guy humor as well.\n
The story is pretty clever. During scholarship student Haruhi Fujioka's first day at Ouran Academy Private School, she "accidentally" joins a host club full of six male gentlemen, (all mistaking her for a guy) from a direct cause of her knocking over an 8,000,000 yen vase. After realizing her true gender at the end of the episode, they continue to have her serve as a host to pay the debt with her guy appearance and personality. The rest of the show is pretty much her tasting the life of rich people, while they taste the life of poor people.\n
There's a bit more in the mangas, but I really don't care for them to be honest. Though I must say this is one anime that I enjoyed 100%. Very good and well made anime that is definitely worth checking out. Whether you're a guy or a girl, this should be enjoyable.

This is a beautiful piece of art, storyline, and voice acting. Haruhi is calm, cool, collected; smart, and sometimes so much so that she seems almost dull at times when the host club is at their most crazy. She almost seems like she wouldn’t be the center of a reverse harem (those not understanding this, its when there are a group of guys for one girl instead of a bunch of girls for the guy… easy enough to get, right?) and pretty much not the type to be swooning over the boys. Well, your pretty much right but that’s what makes Ouran High pop outmore then any other that came before. 


As for the men, well they are as shallow and van as rich, handsome boys can be with a whole matter of stereotypes. A fun thing with this is that they don’t really have every single male going after her, luckily, its more of the ones closer to her age and three get touched on while the forth really hides in the bushes to make way for the other. Yes, I am talking about Tamaki, Kyouya, and the Hitachiin twins Hikaru and Kaoru. 


Let’s touch the first three and then I will get down to my favorite and most logical choice after. Hikaru is the most headstrong of the bunch, the prankster and pretty much the one that gets Kaoru into trouble every once in a while. Kaoru is the one that’s more… well kind in all aspects. When he’s not with his brother, he seems sweet and good natured which might be why most of the girls swoon over the two when they go into their whole boy love thing… among other things… Kaoru always steps back and pushes Hikaru to go after Haruhi so that his brother can find love even though he does make it somewhat clear that he wants a bit of the action as well. 


Kyouya is the brains and mostly profiteer of the host club, looking for the money instead of having the girls have fun, although he is able to pull a fast one when it comes to getting what he wants out of pretty much anyone around him, including Tamaki. Yes, the relationship between Kyouya and Tamaki every once in a while does tend to swing in the ‘we are hot for each other’ way, not that the author isn’t quick to pick up on this fact and uses it to its advantage. There is a good reason why Kyouya is called ‘Mother’ in the host club although if it was for sexual reasons, he would probably be top. Nope, the reason is that I can tell that if he was a woman, he would be one of those girls that will flaunt it just to get anything out of someone.


And last but not least, my all time favorite, Tamaki. Yes, he is an airhead… yes, he is quite clueless… yes, I know he sees himself as a father for Haruhi… uggg… now that freaked me out. No, I will not bring up that joke, he actually figures it out later why it’s strange for him to be calling himself that but no, the reason why I like him to be with Haruhi is simple and it’s one reason on top of many. It’s because he is just like her Father. I know that is crazy but think of it this way, she knows how to take care of someone like that, she knows he has a good heart under all that blond hair, and she knows how pure his intentions were form the start. From the vary start, The Hitachiins would tease her and sometimes even go beyond to harass her, Kyouya really was mostly in it for the money, it seems that the only reason why Tamaki put his heart in soul into making her come with them was mostly, because he liked spending time with her and no matter if he tried to make her into a fully fledged girl, he in the end always went about saying that she needed to be true to herself. (If you can’t tell, I can get into a lot of detail when it’s an anime I really freaken enjoy!)


Now, on to technical merits. The artwork is so beautiful and bright that when they start going comedy, they seem to lost a lot of detail and turn somewhat chibi-fide creatures. And yet, to me it works. I am happy most of the story line doesn’t focus on all the customers that come in, letting the characters shine in their stereotypical designs although… how the hell is Hunny a martial artist? Ya, he looks nothing like it and the blond hair kind of pushes me off there as well. When the story starts to get dark is when most of the details start shining in a aposing danger is on its way, and the shadows mix well in to the details, making them stand out much more. Thoughout the show, there are a lot of roses and I do wish they wouldn’t have so many. Ok… so we know the rose is a symbol of love… we get it… you don’t have to flaunt it every freaken second that they are there for love.


The voice acting is also well done for both Dub and Sub. They pulled out all the stops with Caitlin Glass having solid voice acting next to Maaya Sakamoto for Haruhi. They both gave her more of a cool hearted not caring attitude that made up her character. Even better when she was playing against Vic Mignogna’s rather overly fun character Tamaki. At first, I could not get away from how he sounded just like Edward from Fullmedal Achimest but I can see how the characters fit perfectly. Tamaki has the same style freak outs as Ed whenever someone calls him on something stupid he did or said that I couldn’t help from smile. 


Other Characters got voices like J. Michael Tatum as Kyouya, Todd Haberkorn and Greg Ayres did a unbelievable job keeping the harmony between Kaoru and Hikaru even when the two were speaking ‘with one voice’ as it was. They used Luci Christian as Honey and it worked rather well, pretty much perfectly for the cuteness, Monica Rial as the over Otaku girl Renge, and I could not stop laughing at Patrick Seitz’s depiction of Umehito Nekozawa.

The anime really does catch up with the manga. I've also noticed that anime adaptations tend to be less complicated and shorter but it made it easier to watch. I realize that if it followed the manga completely, it would seem to drag on forever and I could lose interest. Sometimes it felt that way. I'm glad the typical shenanigans were included along with the most important parts of the story, and there were no fillers or anything; this anime was loyal to the plot! I especially appreciated the episodes that included background info on each character, enough so that viewers who haven't read themanga can understand the basics. However, I found that there was less character development, especially in Haruhi. She was surprisngly bold in the last episode, but there wasn't enough time covering her reasons to do so. 


The voice actors were impressive too! Tamaki's voice is fabulous. Hunny's youthful voice really scares me. Kyoya doesn't act his age but the voice is right. Mori's voice is captured perfectly, and I wish he had more lines. The twins have two different voice actors, but they sound great together too. Haruhi's voice was appropriate as well, but I wonder if she could pass for a guy in real life. 


What I'm most impressed with is the animation; the same emotion was captured, and the same jokes were still funny. I'm usually disappointed with anime adaptations because of the more rough, and sometimes uglier artwork, but this company did a good job! It certainly can't be as fancy as the manga, but these guys have really managed to imitate the original artist's artwork. I loved how lively the characters were! Since they frequently let Hatori in on their plans, the anime felt like a good equivalent to the manga. I was very comfortable watching it! 


I was debating with myself on the final episode..I wanted to watch it, but if I did, that would mean everything would be over! Noooo! The ending was happy, but not completely satisfying. But that's how I feel when I really enjoy an anime, I'll always want more. That's my first review, I hope it's not bad;

Sheer brilliance with a beautiful soundtrack. I'm only hoping for a second season.
If your wanting an anime which moves swiftly through the story, not slowing down for slackers and charging through the plot lines, this is not the anime for you.
However if you want to watch a bittersweet comedy which will have you in stitches by the end of each episode, this is the perfect choice.
The story focuses around Haruki Fujioka, a incredibly smart student who gets in to an elite private academy, Ouran High School. Upon entering a music room where she is trying to find a bit of peace and quiet to study,three things happen to act as a catalyst in changing her life.\n
1. She meets the six members of the Ouran Host Club\n
2. She breaks a 8million yen vase.\n
3. She is mistaken for a boy.\n
These three events cause her to be indebted to the Host Club, the moronic (yet, in episodes to come, brilliant) President decides she must become a Host in order to pay off her debt.\n\n
The next 26 episodes are ones, while there is almost a non-existent plot line and you could pick up from almost anywhere so long as you knew a slight bit about the general plot, which will have you laughing - I guarantee it.\n\n
The music swells and fits the anime perfectly. Oboes, flutes, harpsichords and other instruments mirroring the very rich, very elite, very posh and almost classic feel to it. Some pieces, with vibrato strings, will have you and the character your watching racing for an answer, and another oboe piece will mirror the image being shown of the elite academy holding a ball.\n\n
An anime I'd recommend, even to those maybe not fans of shoujo. It has a high re-watch value, even if only watches minutes of a full episode for one brilliant punchline (Episode 22 with Mori's apprentice is fantastic) You will be crying with laughter by the end of it.

This is one of the best anime's I have watched. This is the my first and only anime I have ever wanted to review. I love the character development, the plot, the morals, and the ending. I am more of an action, adventure, supernatural anime type of person but this one was great. This is also the first anime I have ever watched twice (and I have watched my fair share of anime). I really insist you give this anime a try. It gets even more interesting near the end and middle. There are 2 or 3 w/e filler type episodes but those are goodtoo. Ok, thats it for my brief review. I am going back to watch episode 24 again on Netflix.

Story: Haruhi is a scholarship student at Ouran High School, an elite school for the aristocracy and extremely wealthy, whom is forced to join the Host Club after knocking over a vase which costs approximately 8 million yen. Shenanigans ensue as we follow the adventures of the Host Club. I genuinely enjoyed the story line and continue to laugh uproariously. I enjoy the satirical nature of this anime as OHSHC basically takes the piss of many shoujo clichés. 10/10
Art: I adore the way in which this anime is conveyed. The art is beautiful and romantic and often clashes with Haruhi's realistic nature. I cannot faultthe animation! 10/10\n
Sound: I love the opening theme Sakura Kiss and often repeatedly listen to it. The music overall is excellent! 10/10\n
Characters: Every character offers us something unique which I really enjoyed: the prince type, the little devils type, the cool type, the wild type, the loli-shota type and of course the natural type. Personally, I love Tamaki, Hikaru and Kaoru the most because they are absolutely hilarious! 10/10\n
Enjoyment: This was the first anime I have ever watched so perhaps I am being a tad sentimental but I genuinely believe that it is an anime which everyone will enjoy immensely. 10/10

love, love LOVED this anime! 
It was so hysterical! I like how (in a way) it kind of spoofs other anime's along with otaku culture. 
The storyline was great too, how each character had their own story and in the end, how it all lead up to how the host club came into being. The charachters themselves were all truly awesome! I really wish they had continued on and made a second season because there was so much that they left out from the manga!

I'm sorry, but I dropped the anime after a couple of episodes. I was disappointed when I found out the protagonist wasn't who they said they were. I expected the genre to be something completely different. The female admirers that would come by to watch the boys act gay really annoyed me. They were your stereotypical, squealing yaoi fangirls (I'm a fudanshi so I would like to see some male admirers or maybe at least one token gay dude.) One dude almost tried to rape the protagonist. Takami was unlikable. He was a fuckboy. Lol, I sound really bitter because I am. 
However, I didlike their play on your basic bishounen character types, some of the over the top humor, and the level-headed protagonist to balance out the quirky characters.

I am a huge tomboy whether people like it or not. People who looked at me from far away would say that I am a boy. That's why I love this kind of anime and drew by this anime to watch again as I became more critical in the early 20s. An adaptation of manga by the same name created by Bisco Hatori, this is Ouran High School Host Club.
While usually I am drawn by an anime just because of its soundtrack, this anime actually drew me because the theme itself that is rarely being tackled by nowadays anime. A romance story of a tomboylooking girl. So, that's a major A+ for personal enjoyment. 


Aside from personal enjoyment, I really like how the story flows as we started to discover the true personality of Haruhi while discovering the personalities and backstories of each member of the Host Club. I know that it's not easy being around rich people especially if they are your friends. Haruhi managed to capture a smart yet humble commoner in a circle of rich kids. She knew how to hold her heads high while she would occasionally feel guilty for her friends paid everything for her. The comedy itself usually rotates around how Haruhi adapted to her damned rich friends which I could relate so much.


By the way, I personally enjoyed Haruhi's English Dub. While the original Japanese captured the vibe of Haruhi as a boy whose voice has not developed from puberty, the English dub captured the vibe as a deep female voice that usually being mistaken as a boy's which, for me, is a better representation for a girl who is being mistaken as a boy. And yes, I love a Seiyuu who has androgynous voice and think that is a talent to have such voice. So, if you got some down time, you should check the dubbed version, too.


Overall, this anime probably a must watch anime for you who love Shoujo anime and for you who proclaimed yourself as a tomboy. This anime really proofs to me that we need more tomboy romance anime more than we already have.

This show is very entertaining even if you do not like the romantic comedy genre. You will fall in love with the characters' personalities and this show is one to make you laugh your head off at them. Haruhi's outspoken personality will bring a huge grin to your face as you see some of the club members try to impress her and fail. You will also get to know some of the characters and the problems they face and cry beside them. This show displays a true family and is just amazing. Overall this show is incredibly impressive and despite the sound of the storyline,many different people enjoy it and the characters.

I'd say the only problem with Ouran High School Host Club is that... it's so SHORT!
The manga's been completed for a while now, I'm pretty sure that any studio could just adapt the rest of the manga just fine. I'm not sure why they haven't done it yet, though...
Either way, Ouran is funny, original (for example: where else could you find out that a main character's father is a DRAG QUEEN?!?!), sweet (the romance part is so cute! You can't help but root for all the characters) and yet it has its serious moments.
Even if the last episode isn't an actual "ending" to the story,I still very much loved it. Now I'm off to read the rest of the manga to find out how the rest of this story goes!

Ouran High School Host Club has been a breath of fresh air that has been much needed for myself. At first glance this is some cheesy romance which only has its worth in half-assed jokes and the ever present fanservice which is rampant in the industry. However, Ouran has been a story of depth and turns at every corner that has kept me excited as well as yearning for more, and yet a cheesy romance.
The story evolves around Haruhi, a girl who is forced to work for a Host Club, and the six other members of said Host Club. She is a commoner who madeher way into the Ouran School, a private elite institution. As a member of the Host Club, she conceals her identity as a women and acts like a man to pay of her debt for breaking a vase the club was going to auction off.


That is the premise of the story and it is an interesting tale. Each character is fully developed and interesting while they are also reminiscent of the common stereotypes they are. As the story goes on we see they are not the stereotypical characters we at first saw and that they are much more than that. They have faults and they have something to call their own.


The character I have an issue with, the only big issue I have with the series, is Mitsukuni. While I loved the ‘twincest’ going on with Hikaru and Kaoru, I just could not bring myself to enjoy Mitsukuni. I thought it a bit outrageous how feared Mitsukuni had become and how he nonchalantly he threw off his brother. Frankly, I think he is a little shit and my least favorite character of the entire series. Granted, this is anime and realism must take a back seat when criticising it, unless the show makes an actual attempt to be real.


The art has been a mix of what we are use to and of something more childish. The opening, though I had mixed feelings at first, I have come to love. It is something different, something other than what we all are use to. The ending, however, did not look as appealing as the opening was. Likely because of the style used to draw the characters, but that is just my personal opinion. The music for each was amazing and worth sitting through twenty-six times. The soundtracks for the piece fit very well and did not drag down the story. Sound and art were well done.


The show has its faults and is not perfect. I have yet to come across an anime that is perfect and Ouran has been one of the many anime I have watched to get close to what I would expect of a perfect anime. It is enjoyable and fun to watch. Ouran, though I was not its target audience, was greatly relatable and enjoyable.


Story: 9/10

Enjoyment: 10/10


Rounded Total: 9/10

Ouran High School Host Club is one of the first animes for a while now that was able to keep me entertained from beginning to end. I seriously finished the series in a week I was that into it.
Story:
Though the story had a tendency to be just purely random, I like the creativity of using a host club as a main component of the series. It's something a little different than the normal high school based series. The fact that Haruhi gets dragged into this despite what sex she was made the story line even more entertaining. If you are looking for something to justsit back and watch for a laugh and no serious thinking, this is a good series.


Art:

The art was very good, not the best in my opinion, especially when it came to showing off Haruhi as being a cute girl, I think the artists could have made her look a little cuter, because she kind of looked ordinary in many scenes and they went on like she was the cutest thing ever. Ouran High School Host Club does have that traditional anime style that I like of over exaggerated facial features when someone is confused, mad, excited, happy, etc. 


Sound:

I'm going to say, though I have not watched the Sub version, I think the dub version was pretty good. I really like how they picked a voice actor for Haruhi that sounds somewhere in the middle of male and female and that can be easily confused with either one. That is the main thing that I think of when I think of sound for this series, is the good choice of voice actors, at least in my opinion.


Character:

I believe the characters were pretty well developed. In the beginning of the series you get to know the characters and you think "Oh, he's a jerk" or "He is the cutest little thing ever!" but then, through out the series you realize there is more to those characters than the first impression they give you. 


Enjoyment:

This series had me completely hooked. I HAD to watch all of it as soon as I started. There was only one episode where I started getting bored, but by the end of the episode I was dieing to watch the next one.


Overall:

It was a great series, not to the point I think it is a masterpiece, but I'm very glad I watched it and I understand why it is fairly popular. ^^

I fisrt tried watching Host Club two years ago when a friend of mine recommended it to me. When I found out it was a shoujo and a reverse harem, I was very skeptical about it. Furthermore, the last show I had watched was Death Note, and I was not ready for the tone shift between one show and the other. Also, I'm not a big fan of episodic shows. All these reasons led me to drop Host Club at the time. But now, having watched a lot of shows since then and, consequentially, having changed taste and perspective quite a bit,I decided to give Host Club another shot, and I am very glad I did. It takes a very overused and worn out formula and polishes it up, gives it a fancy dress, teaches it to have some goddamn attitude and sends it to the highschool prom. In fact, none of these comparisons were chosen at random: Host Club does not limit itself to all the clichés and tropes found in similar anime, but rather embraces them and completely messes them up afterwards to make something refreshing and interesting to pretty much anyone.


   This handling is first and best seen in its characters. Every single member of the host club starts out as typical as typical gets, each one having one specific characteristic that makes them more or less appealing to the girls than the others. Where Host Club stands out in its genre is how it develops the cast throughout the show. The way each character is presented at the beginning serves only as an archetype to give them a base on which they can build upon. Each member is given some exposition, normally in the form of a flashback, showing who they were before joining the host club. Without giving any spoilers, I can safely say that all characters had backdrop that excused their way of being. Here, Host Club shows its social commentary facet. We see that the characters are heavily influenced by their economic status. The contrast between the rich boys from the host club and the poor protagonist works in favor of the show, and ultimately serves to show how everyone is a product of their social status and is forced to deal with the conditions they were born in to the best of their capabilities. 


   This not only serves the purpose of explaining the characters' personalities, but it is also shown in the present time as well. Many times we see the club members' families' influences. In one of the earlier episodes, Haruhi has to take a physical exam which would expose her true gender to the whole school. The conflict is resolved because the school's medical team took orders from one of the host club member's family, and so they found a way around the problem. Note that this was not simply a half assed excuse pulled out of nowhere to save the protagonist: it had been previously established that the boy's family had control of the biggest hospitals in all of Japan. It's little things like these that make Host Club stand out. 


   Another particular thing that I don't usually see mentioned is Haruhi's father's travesti behaviour. It's not often that I feel like a character benefited a diferent sexual preference or identity, and it's usually just for fan service. But here, not only did it went well with Haruhi's tendencies to prefer male's clothes, but it was also taken advantage of for one of the episodes, even if at a small degree. I felt the need to dedicate a paragraph only to his character just to be able to rub it on Mirai Nikki's writer and say "THIS IS HOW YOU MAKE QUEER CHARACTERS, MOTHERFUCKER!"


   And speaking of fanservice, don't be fooled into thinking Host Club doesn't have any. Like I said, the show is simply a well executed and refreshing take on an established formula: it is still a slice of life reverse harem with lots of romance and fanservice at heart. In fact, from colorful and apealling visuals to a cheesy soundtrack ranging from classical to pop (that goddamn opening...) to quirky characters, it's as typical as typical gets. A highschool attended only by rich kids, the nerdy girl surrounded by a bunch of good looking guys, the fact that each host club member is defined by a "type", and the whole concept of a Host Club in general for that matter. Everything is so overblown that it just becomes downright fun to watch. It's sort of like the "so bad it's good" effect, but in this case it's something like "it's so typical that it stands out", in a good way.


   And so, to conclude, although it is not the pinnacle of character development and it doesn't really have anything new to present, Ouran Highschool Host Club is a very enjoyable show, that can appeal even to people who dislike its genre. Now I finally have something good to recommend to my friends who like cheesy romances and hunky boys to write fanfics about.

#Kisskissfallinlove

I watched Ouran Highschool Host Club absolutely ages ago - I probably watched it during the year when I first started to realize what anime was, and when I first started to get into it. I adored the show when I first saw it, and every time I come back to it, I love it a little more. 
The Story - The overall plot line of the show isn't anything groundbreaking or amazing, nor is it something that's overused and dull; it's a pretty decent story with no major flaws at all, but rather one that has charm and keeps you hooked without being toheavy. In other words, it's easy to watch without making the viewer feel babied or stupid. 


The Art - I personally loved the art style; its bright but not gaudy, each character is distinguishable from the next, and it really gives the show its aforementioned charm. The animation flows and from a show made over 10 years ago, it still looks pretty darn great now and will hopefully stand the test of time. 


The Sound - The opening is catchy and every time I hear it, it brings back the memories of watching the show and forces a great big smile across my face. The ending was okay, but nothing particularly memorable, and I can't really remember much of the background music/the rest of the OST to be honest - I feel like it wasn't very memorable anyway. 


The Characters - I won't delve too deep into the characters, as I feel that they are the things that make the show what it is, and I wouldn't want to ruin the experience for anyone who hasn't seen it. Each character is different from the next and has entirely different quirks and (I feel like I'm using this word a lot) charms. There is also a lot of character development - obviously some characters get more screen time than others do, but none are left out, and they all are shown to develop their relationships with each other. The characters truly make or break a show for me (probably for most people as well), and the cast were definitely my favourite part.


Enjoyment - Every time I rewatch OHSHC, I fall in love with it a little more; I feel closer to the characters, I laugh harder at all the silly little jokes, and it takes up a bigger spot in my heart each time. It's easy to watch and you have so much fun as you watch it, you feel invested in the characters and want to see how their relationships develop further, and you'll find yourself smiling after each episode. 


Overall, I give Ouran Highschool Host Club an 8 out of 10. It's certainly not the best show ever, nor is it groundbreaking but, I had such a good time watching it, I loved seeing the characters and their relationships grow, and I fell in love with the show. It holds a special place in my heart, and I hope that you'll give it a shot.

I wanted to like Ouran more than this; the art is beautiful, the MC is refreshing, and the whole 'reverse-harem' shtick is a guilty pleasure of mine. On top of that, it seems to be generally really well-received and enjoyed.
Alas, I gave it all 26 episodes to win me over, but it never really happened. Although Haruhi is refreshing as an MC (intelligent, not clueless, not tsundere but not easily swayed by emotions, etc.), the rest of the characters in the show are really, really terrible. Although the show makes some attempt at conveying self-awareness that all the other Host Club members are representations ofanime/manga archetypes, they don't go far enough as to be true parodies. Had they pushed the characters a little more, the show could've been hilarious; as it is, the characters are simply SUPER obnoxious. They become uber-representations of the 'type' they're supposed to lampoon, which makes it profoundly difficult to a) enjoy the show and b) like any of the characters outside Haruhi. 


Simply put, Ouran tries to subvert the harem genre but doesn't quite push it far enough; the result is boring, 'why-do-I-care-about-this...?', long-winded series whose only redeeming feautures are its gorgeous art and decently unique MC. I would honestly recommend skipping this title. This is the first time I have ever thought a series or movie was *seriously* overrated on MAL, and I felt compelled to share my two cents.

Here, is a story of an oddball group of would-be-hosts that certainly define "true" entertainment in a more cheery context.
Ouran High School Host Club is an anime that brings laughter, joy and bliss in so many yet crazy ways. Straightforward it may be, this anime shares life's deeper meaning in several serious instances yet it manages to smoothly shift the somber mood to an exaggeratedly hilarious scene.
Even before any of these amusing scenes make one's stomach explode, the catchy opening song entitled "Sakura Kiss" by Chieko Kawabe greets the viewers with even more thematic artistry and ingenuity that sure are eye candies. After making varioustummies aches, each episode closes with fast-paced ending song entitled "Shissou" by Last Alliance that features the manga counterpart of Ouran in video.\n\n
Vibrant colors and proper textures blend harmoniously with gaudy style animation. Suffice to say, from the largest structural design down to every nook and cranny, was done with top-notch accentuation for class. The characters in this anime were the ones who were given utmost highlight because each of them were uniquely yet stereotypically drawn to match their personality and give life to the story's well-fleshed-out character development. Also, the array of expressions and super-deformed scenes they made were remarkable.\n\n
From Studio BONES comes one of the greatest anime novelties the world has ever known. A total package off odd situations, appealing characters plus a dash of solid substance brings out the novelties finest in OHSHC. The greatest part is that it managed to maintain the most enjoyable aspects of comedy and slapstick without relying too much on predictable gags; the humor of the series grew and emerged naturally out of its own little crazy set-up.

The anime-only comedy could only be pulled off in this story and on T.V. Love it.
