The Ouran High School Host Club is both funny and Romantic! I loved this show and wished that there was a season 2! Bravo for all the hard work they put on this show! Bravo!!! My favourite characters were the Hitachiin brother and Honey Sempai! They were the funniest + Tamaki sempai too! The Ouran High School Host Club is something worth watching and I had this show on hold for a week cause I was watching Haikyuu! But after season 2 of Haikyuu, I continued to watch Ouran High School Host Club, because It left me on the edge of my seat. It isa show worth watching!

Finally......I can review something I actually kinda sorta enjoyed quite a bit.
Story: A poor girl gets accepted into this prestigious school for the extremely wealthy and blah blah blah. What I like about the story is how its not too complicated. It is easy to follow and for the most part, and keeps watchers entertained. Unfortunately, they seem to keep most of the interesting parts in the manga portion of the series, which is a letdown. For instance, I would have liked to see at least a little bit of the romance that happens between the two main characters. Its quite a shame sincethey are both have great personalities, and aren't annoying like other couples(cough*kirito*cough*asuna*). The story also seems a bit generic. Maybe it wasn't at its time, I mean the anime is kinda old, but that whole 'rich boy meets poor girl' kinda gets annoying after a while. I have to hand it to the anime for at least making the rich guy sweet and likeable.

I'll give the story a 6.


Art: While its not deplorable, the art did not exactly wow me. I found the flowery backgrounds quite corny to be honest. I wish the animators would have spent more time giving some life to the characters and their facial expressions. The actual character designs were great though. Haruhi is cute, and the boys are as handsome as they are meant to be. 

The school uniforms for the girls need to be burned though. 

5 :/


Sound: Whoever voiced Haruhi deserves a hug. She doesn't sound like an overly kawaii character who swallows a bucket of helium before talking to people. Nice and chill. I like it. I recognize Tamaki's voice actor from other anime, and he's great, but at times I wish he'd tone down on the dramatic lines a bit. Others are fine, but nothing too special. 7


Characters: Now this is what surprisingly made me enjoy the anime. Haruhi possesses qualities that other anime heroines lack. Shes as smart as people say she is. She is also kind, caring, but has her limits. 

Oh, and she's short. Like me. So for that she gets extra points :p

Tamaki is gorgeous, and acts like a prince, but is not shallow, which is something that's important to me. I really like how fond he is of Haruhi, and how much he cares about his friends. It made me want to be friends with him, which is good, because that's how main protagonists should be. They shouldn't make you want to punch them in the face, at least not all the time. I do wish his past wasn't talked about so late in the anime. It could have served a better purpose than some of the filler. As for Hikaru and Kaoru, I have mixed feelings. Hikaru is my main problem. I couldn't tell if he was a nice, a devil, or a tsundere. Kaoru is fine, Mitsukuni is kinda annoying, Mori is bae, Kyouya is......hhhhhhhhhhhh i dont know or care, and Renge needs to leave. Now from this, you'd think the character rating would be mediocre. Nah, the dad was amazing. He was funny and refreshing. 

9.


Enjoyment: If you like shoujo-related stuff, this might be just the anime for you. The stuff that's good is very good, but if you like action with tons of character development, run FAR FAR away. 

But this is about me, not you :P So i'll give it an 8.

This a great episodic slice of life comedy. The focus in this anime really is on the comedy and doesn't weigh you down with a lot of heavy thought provoking story lines, romance, or tear jerking moments. But that doesn't mean it doesn't have substance. The characters are well developed and even though each episode is a self contained story the overall arc of the series does a great job at showing the growth in the bonds between the characters. The last two episodes take on a bit more serious tone but still mix in a good amount of humor. The show also isn't yourtypical harem slice of life as you probably noticed. Doing a reverse harem story line is a refreshing change of pace opening it up for different kinds of humor.

Here's the thing: This was the first anime I ever saw and loved, the first anime that made me want to watch more. Even if, years down the line, I revisit this series and hate every last minute of it, it will always be important to me because of that fact alone.
However, I don't think that's likely, because this is a comedy that may as well have been constructed after consulting my brain.
All of the characters are snarky and witty, but utterly sincere when it counts. The boys of the Host Club proper all begin as teen angst dramedy stereotypes who are slowly fleshed outinto three-dimensional characters, and the chemistry they share with each other and Haruhi is priceless.


I love all the little ways this show satirizes modern teen pop media and their fanbases. Like, how all the patronesses of the club go nuts for Hikaru and Kaoru's homo-incestuous act, or for that scene between Ritsu and Haruhi; it's the most perfect mirror of slash fandom I think I will ever see. Tamaki steals the show time and time again with his over-the-top fantasies of how he will capture Haruhi's heart, only to be constantly stifled by her levelheaded common sense. And the little blonde girl who knows tons of manga/anime tropes because all she reads are shoujo manga. Or the thousand other moments of pure comedic genius, satire and not, that I'm currently forgetting. There's even an "Alice in Wonderland" episode, a tribute to one of my favorite stories-- and animated Disney movies-- ever.


I don't think there's much left I can say. I adore this show, and I think I always will, on some level, no matter how much anime I watch, no matter what shows I love, this will always rise a little above the rest, if only because it's my first.


My journey as an anime watcher is just beginning, but I see no end in sight. Thank you, Ouran.


xoxo,

Amazing_Grace

Ouran Koukou Host Club is, and always will be one of my favorites. The first episode is interesting, but it doesn't serve the whole show justice. If you watch the first episode and don't like it yet, I recommend sticking through and watching one or two more. 
I fell in love with all the characters, and they might be based on cliches, but in the end, they become much more than that. I think the show is beautiful because it tackles real-world issues in a good, realistic way, which not all shows can do. I love this anime as a whole, and I hope youwill too.

Ouran was the first anime I ever watched, and honestly raised my interest in the genre more than most other anime probably could have. I was a bit skeptical starting this, as the thumbnail was covered with flowers and seemed to resemble a typical romantic comedy, but not even 2 minutes in I was pleasantly surprised. I recommend this for everyone, even those who don't enjoy the rom-com genre.
Story-9
The story is incredibly fresh and original. Featuring an androgynous main character, as well as an amazing supporting cast who the plot and storyline depend on greatly, it seems set up for the shenanigans everyone gets into.Ouran is an obvious play on other animes in the shoujo genre, but it's amazzing because of that fact; the characters aren't afraid to point out the absurdity of the episodes, with the main character (Haruhi) being well known for not understanding the other students. It's a reverse play on the stereotypical "notice me senpai" trope that is ever so common, and instead focuses on one more along the lines of "please stop noticing me senpai, I'm tired."


Art-8

The art style in this was simply gorgeous. While I'm not a fan of the typical shoujo genre, I can rewatch this anime while in the same level of awe as the first time I watched it. There are a lot of gags that blatantly point out situations, as well as imagery representing some of the many problems the characters go through. Emphasis on many.


Sound-9

While I don't remember much of the background music, aside from Tamaki's piano, the main theme is such a catchy and well written tune that it can get me singing every time I watch this.


Character-9

While the characters may seem to fit into the typical Shoujo stereotypes, this is completely intentional. In the first episode, they point out each character's most well-known and desired traits, and they constantly treat the genre as a joke.

I'm not going into depth to explain each character, but I will say this: each character has a designated trope they were designed to follow in, but each matures through the course of the show and proves that they are better than their one main strength.


Enjoyment-10

I enjoyed this so much, Ouran is incredibly hard to beat in this category. I binge watched the entire show in two days over a holiday, and after completing it, felt the need to watch it all over again. The characters and plot draw you in, and the one season leaves you wanting more (I recommend the manga as well, it was created before the anime and continues where the anime leaves off).


Overall-9

While not a perfect 10, Ouran was and probably is one of my favorite animes, even after years of others. As stated before, I honestly recommend this to anyone. If you are curious about whether or not you'll enjoy it, my one tip is to try an episode. Chances are, you'll love it.

I LOVED Ouran Highschool Host Club. It was highly enjoyable, and is actually one of my favorites. It's also an anime that earned a spot on my favorite dub list, which is really rare.
Story-
I loved the story. Haruhi breaking a vase in the Host Club room and having to dress up as a a boy to repay her debt and work for the club, only for the club to find out that Haruhi's a girl after the first episode.
The story is so carefree, yet at the same time having its serious moments.
Art-
I love the Ouran art style. It is quite nice and simple. A memorablestyle.


Sound-

Good quality sound. At least on my standards, depending where you watch it. Crunchyroll doesn't have Ouran Highschool Host Club. I managed to get it off YouTube in both dub and sub.


Characters-

I loved the Ouran Highschool Host Club characters. They are memorable and unique.


Haruhi- Known as the 'natural' in the Host Club. Haruhi is a smart character that tries to see the best in the world.


Tamaki- 'Ladies Man', 'Charmer'. Tamaki is quite the flirt. While being quite popular to the guests of the Host Club, after hours Tamaki can be quite immature and 'overreacts' when Haruhi is with other men.


Hikaru & Kaoru- Twins. The two are quite mischievous. They play around with Haruhi just to work Tamaki up. While in the Host Club, the two have a 'bromance' and make all the girls squeel.


Honey- Ahh.. The loli-shota character. I swear, he's seventeen. Honey portrays a quite cute and young character, in reality he is much older. He enjoys sweets and cute things while being quite talented in martial arts.


Mori- Not much to say here.. Mori is the strong silent type that is there to accompany Honey. 


Kyoya- Oh, man... Kyoya is the brains of the Host Club. He helps keep the club in order and not in debt. He's also the one who keeps Haruhi's debt at a view and makes it nearly impossible for her to pay it off.


Enjoyment- 

Well, I said before this is now a favorite for me, so you can tell I quite enjoyed this anime. I have my fair share in shoujo anime. I enjoyed seeing the characters get along with each other and make complete fools out of each other. And when I watched the dub, I understood everything. I usually have great connections with favorite anime, and I then remembered I had watched this anime when I was younger. That making it clear why the art style, characters, opening, and major scenes were so familiar.


Overall-

I love this series. It is one worth watching. The only bad thing I see in it is the fact it cuts off at the end. It cuts off leaving the rest of the story completely oblivious. For that, it pretty much expects you to read the manga. If the rumors are true in saying that there will be a season two October 2017, the series deserves that second season. I just hope they don't end up making material that doesn't hardly connect with the first season and is not as good as the manga.

i can't think of anything i didnt like about this anime, all of it is awesome!

In a word, this anime is awesome. Like most shojo, the main plot is established in the first episode and the rest of the series is the misadventures of the cast and character development, but Ouran's quirky humor and ability to make fun of itself and it's genre is what sets it apart. Ouran knows the plot is unrealistic and silly and likes to point that out. Another thing that makes Ouran different is the heroine, Haruhi, who couldn't care less about boys and looking pretty. Where most shojo heroines are pining away for some unreachable guy, Haruhi is the opposite, more concerned with herschoolwork and earning money to suport her family. For once, the heroine is the resonable one and the guys are the crazy comedic relief.

Kiss, kiss, fall in love!
All I can say is that: this is one of the shoujo anime I've enjoyed from episode 1 to 26. What can I say, I finished the whole series in just one night.
STORY : 9/10
I love the story, from the time Haruhi entered the Host Club room, to their wacky costumes, club events, TO the time someone FINALLY realized he's in love with her [name censored to avoid spoiler!], I enjoyed it. :) I laughed with the crazy twins, go Kya~ with Hani-senpai, the know-it-all Kyouya, the deadly silent Mori-sensei, and finally, the EVER-SLOW, but still very sweet, Tamaki Suoh.
ART :9/10

I love their chibi forms, that all I can say. And their Ouran High uniforms rock too, as they fit for being the uniform for a RICH school. :D


(I love the way they portray Tamaki's sulky days though. XD)


SOUND : 9/10

"Sakura Kiss" was fit for being the opening song. It was catchy, and found myself putting the song to repeat during the first few months after listening to it. :)) I'm hooked at the orchestral vibe of most of the songs in the OST, fit for the "royal"-like setting of the series.


CHARACTER : 10/10

You'll love EVERYONE from the Host Club, even the manager herself. XD Every character has their own strength... and weakness. Not everyone's story was told here though, since the anime has only 26 episodes, but that's fine. :)


ENJOYMENT : 10/10

Like I've said earlier, I finished the whole thing fast. :)) I found myself itching for more (I go for Tamaki and Haruhi forever!) so I didn't realize I reached until the end of the series.


Overall, this is a 9 for me. :) When my friends ask for shoujo recommendations this anime is #1 on my list. If you want to fall in love and laugh at the same time, this anime's for you. :D

First review. I'll try not to give too many spoilers.
	A girl surrounded by hot, rich guys, and concealing her gender to catch clients in order to pay back her debt. A school with seemingly nonexistent teachers and rules that are questionable. Some of it already sounding cliché? Yeah, it is. But it's all put together in a unique way.
	I refused to watch this for the longest time even though it was repeatedly recommended. I didn't even read the review before watching it on a random impulse. As the summary above states, “Unable to repay her debt with money, Haruhi found herself with no choice butto work for the Host Club, becoming a male host herself” I thought this would be about a stupid heroine easily swayed and awed by popularity and manipulated by good looks who thought her life was tragic because of the debt she had brought upon herself. I was so, so wrong.


STORY 9/10

	Probably the thing I loved the most about Ouran High was that, right when you think the story is about to get serious, sappy, or the comedy is overdone, it'd turn around and make an awesome comeback where you just have to crack up. My only problem was the ending. Even though most of our favorite animes are stopped on a dime with a completely different ending from the manga, this one was just ruined. Even if you didn't read the manga, you could tell right away when it deviated from it – when all the humor and everything you came to like about the anime just completely dies. Which is why I gave it a nine.


ART 10/10

	Admittedly, the art for the characters might leave you feeling like something is lacking, but it wasn't awkward or chaotic. I loved all the characters expressions. However, the background was done quite well; you don't feel like if you looked anywhere but at the characters you'd find things you wouldn't like. 


CHARACTERS 10/10

	The characters are the most attractive thing about the anime. Each one unique in their way, and you can't help but fall in love with all of them. All the main characters have a story to be told, and express themselves in so many different ways.


MUSIC 5/10

	It wasn't terrible, and the first song is kinda catchy.


OVERALL 9/10

	It's an extremely entertaining anime, and I found myself laughing til I cried, so much that my parents were worried about me if they were around. If you're stingy about character development, perhaps it isn't the best for you to watch it. It's something that kind of happens subtlety and is hard to notice.


SUB 9/10

	The seiyus they picked for the most important characters were excellent, especially for the main heroine and hero.

This is my first review. I'm not going to tell you what the anime is about, that's what the synopsis is for.
Anyway... I'll tell you why this show is the most overrated anime in the world. I'm a girl, bi, and I LOVE gender-benders... so naturally, I should love this show because Haruhi is posing as a boy, right? No... I hated it. The characters were "okay"... but they were all stereotypes.. and VERY typical. And the comedy? I never laughed... not once. The drama? THERE WASN'T ANY! Sure, some people will TELL you there was... but there really wasn't. I often finished an episodefeeling so bored that I could just fall asleep.\n\n
Also, the story is terrible. The entire time, I was waiting for the story to climax... and have this HUGE twist that we wouldn't have seen coming. Alas, there wasn't one. I've watched Baka and Test, Mayo Chiki, and other nonsensical anime that I ended up loving... but this one fails, tremendously, to catch my attention.

Ouran High School Host Club is a show about really handsome guys making women happy. But they all hold a secret: their newest member is actually a girl. They keep the secret to themselves and must face different challenges to make sure it stays that way.
In all sense, this is practically a reverse harem. After a short while a sense of romance will be picked up by most of the club members and will constantly annoy each other by trying to advance their relationship with Haruhi, their new female club member. This goes on for quite a long time.
~Characters 8/10~
The character development is quite good,seeing how they try to deepen the characters throughout each episode, leaving some episodes directly dedicated to certain club members. You'll find the usual reverse harem types: short and cute, quiet and stoic, loud obnoxious, self-interested business type and the homo twins.


Each character possess unique skill sets allowing them to be a perfect group.


~Story 7/10~

The story is not unique and follows a lot of the basic anime school formulas, such as the beach scenes, uniforms, cosplay, bad-mouthing the poor, elaborate dresses/outfits etc... It all seems very typical.


The main story is basically a simple framework (or skeleton), thus allowing each character to be mend their own back stories into the main one, thickening the story and plots while helping the audience understand why the characters act the way they do.


The story is a lot more typical and stereotypical than that, but it kept my interest in such a moe driven show.

If you are wanting romance development, you can pretty much just start on episode 20.


~Sound 9/10~

The sounds, dialogue and music are not genre defining, but I really enjoyed the way they used the music. The artists used classical Mozart to get the point across in certain scenes allowing a very deep emotional connection to the current story.


~Art 7/10~

Although, I am not a big fan of moe, this show did your typical male moe.

The male beauty was not over-exaggerated which was a plus, but you can definitely tell a difference between high-class and low-class moe if you watch this show.


~Enjoyment 7/10~

I enjoyed the show for a while, but near the end of the series I found myself getting bored with the lack of romance development and especially getting bored since a lot of the same things were getting repeated. Scenes of frantic running would be continuously repeated and would drive me insane. And this show is yet another that focuses on competition and contests as a form of rivalry to win the heart of Haruhi. These contests can be very repetitive since they show up several times throughout the series.


But overall, the show isn't bad, it's certainly a way to waste time, but it isn't something I'll be re-watching anytime soon.

This awesome reverse harem anime is a must see for all you rom-com fans! I absolutely adored this anime and must say it is one of my favourites as a big fan of rom-coms myself. 
STORY- so this anime revolves around a female character named Haruhi, where due to certain circumstances needs to join the host club to pay her debt off. However, the host club full of, gorgeous and enchanting male characters needs to pretend that Haruhi is a male, the 'natural' as they as. She develops an attached relationship with the 6 members of the host club and realises that the host clubis not simply about entertaining girls with 'a lot of time on their hands' but also about others happiness. The character development is superb as each characters background is explored, and at no point does the anime get boring! 


ART- although the graphics are not the best i've seen, they are not bad at all. I mean the guys are pretty hot, and Haruhi sure is kawaii! All the scenes are pretty detailed and colours are used well, it is not limited. The art is pretty typical, but i mean its not greatly old or anything. 


SOUND- the opening song sure fits the whole anime. The sound throughout is completely fine, and each voice suits the designated character. The soundtracks used throughout the anime are fitting to individual scenes and pretty nice overall. 


CHARACTER- the character development is great, amusing, loving and they care about each other. It's really nice to see how Haruhi's relation develops with each character, and it just keeps you wanting to see more. It's nice to see how bonds form between all the characters, and i was always excited to see if Haruhi would develop a romantic interest in a character in particular! 


ENJOYMENT- i scored this anime a 10, because i genuinely think this anime is one of the best i've ever seen. I've been searching like crazy to find something as awesome as this! This anime has surely secured a place in my heart lol! 


OVERALL- so overall... i would highly recommend this anime to any rom-com fans, or anyone who is just looking for a light hearted anime, i absolutely loved loved loved this anime.

Ouran High School is definitely my favorite anime. Once again, though, the "dead parent" thing is over-used, but it's still a cute story line this anime has, especially once the show progresses into the summer.
You'll love the characters, I promise you that.

For anyone who loves a simple harem story where the girl is the main character this series is for you. The unique but simplistic story line is easy to follow and allows a watcher to still use their brains and try to guess the outcomes. comparatively, most harem stories have a twisted reason or story line that kind of takes focus off of the main characters for some time and can also cause the anime to split in different directions,sometimes,even getting off of the original stories plot.This anime reveals things as very entertaining and gradually in perfect rhythm to the story, matching the backgrounds andexpectations of the characters to a 'T", nothing seemed rushed. The artwork probably needed a little more detail as far as HD improvement but the line and unique drawings give the characters a whimsical feel to the whole story. I especially loved it when the comparisons to common vs rich folk expectations were realized. A story as a commoner myself can relate too, specifically can register a quick nod and laugh while giving recognition to the both types of economical classes while, giving exemplary recognition of each classes problems. Another fall back though is the story line doesn't get complicated like other harems  with love triangles and lots of eye candy details ,but, if they decide to complete a second season you will bet I would be the one to watch it and see if they have the same consistency. Best part, this story is considered PG13 in my case, So its safe for a whole family of Otakus to enjoy. Happy watching :)

Well, well, well. This was faaaar beyond my expectations. -adjusts glasses-. 
Also, spoiler free revieeeeeeew~!
For what I know Ouran High School Host Club, is the most popular reverse harem anime. It's what I believe in because this is the most recommended and talked about when you say "reverse harem". 
Anyway, I definitely recommend reading both anime and manga for they have quite some twists in it. Though, I think manga should be prioritized. 
Brief review pointing out what I can.
Anyway. Let's get started! 
Story is: 9 
I'd have to give it to them. They revolve around realistically and the turn of events are surprisingly good.The "idiotic" acts of the characters gives off a nice spice to the scenes and stuff. \n
The story's unique and very original. I must say, this anime is not only appealing to girls, but it may be enjoyed by many. It has a really good laugh into it! \n
I'm lucky to have my own room or else my parents would've thought that I've gone crazy already...\n\n
Anyway! Here we have the commoner scholar, Fujioka Haruhi, in Ouran High School, which is a reserved school for the wealthy and renowned students. Having troubles on finding a quiet place to study, she stumbled upon an "abandoned" room which is the third music room. There, she discovers that the Host Club with wealthy, gorgeous guys lies in there. Upon showing apathy, she ends up breaking a vase costing a huge amount of money. She can't possibly repay it, therefore in order to pay back, she must work as a host until the given quota is reached. (y)\n\n
The pace was neat. Even though occasionally it's quite slow. Although it's slow, you really wouldn't feel it if you were totally into it. I needed to restrain myself most of the time that's why I noticed (I always watch at like 2 am and stuff. ehehe..he........ '-'). \n\n
Art is: 8\n\n
Since it was quite an old anime, the design is a bit on the old style ones, ne? But nevertheless, the character design's definitely killing it! The main characters were indeed captivating-- both girls and boys >:D

This was the first anime I ever watched (not including Ghibli films) so my review may be biased based on the fact that it holds a special place in my heart (forgive me for sounding sentimental).
The reason I love this anime is the fact it is simply so much fun to watch, yet you still find yourself becoming emotionally attached to the character's in the show (to the point where it's hard to pick a favourite, they're all so damn lovable).
Another thing I loved is that each character has a clearly defined stereotype (the show itself mocks this) however as the episodes progress they eachclearly grow as human beings and their story arcs are progressed with both depth and light-heartedness. The cast is very diverse personality-wise, yet each characters personality bounces perfectly off the others, leading to some great jokes and plot points. 


The story is predictable somewhat, if you're looking for an intense anime with a rich and deep storyline this probably isn't for you, at its core the anime is comedic and does mock "serious" story arcs, or at least interjects comedic elements into them, this could either make the story arcs more enjoyable for you or ruin them all together, it all depends on what type of person you are. 


The art also has a strong comedic element, which is what I found funniest about the anime, again this could go two ways, you could love it or hate it. 


I'd say definitely give it a chance, it's enjoyable and you'll probably laugh your ass off throughout it.

This is my third time watching Ouran High School Host Club as I was lucky enough to find it on Netflix :) I finally decided to review it so I hope it will be helpful.
For anyone that is unfamiliar with Ouran, it is about an intelligent high school student named Haruhi Fujioka who is accepted into the prestigious Ouran Academy as an honour student. Haruhi is looking for a place to study and then stumbles into the 3rd music room where the Ouran Host Club runs their club activities. There Haruhi is introduced to a group of 6 pretty rich boys who entertain female studentsafter class, headed by half Japanese, half French charmer Tamaki Suou. Haruhi is stunned by the oddness of the group and accidentally breaks an expensive vase. The story follows Haruhi, whom is dressed as a male but is revealed to be female, as she must repay the debt (caused by the broken vase) by being a member of this host club.


Story: 8/10

This is a very typical shojo anime, taking advantage of common story lines such as the gender bender, the school festival, the beach episode, and common tropes/characteristics such as glittering eyes, male fan service for the ladies and bright, flamboyant colours. But what makes it unique is that it does not take itself seriously. They go over the top using typical bishounen characteristics to define the 7 "men" of the host club, break the laws of physics and reason, and frequently "break the fourth wall" by talking directly to the audience, and sometimes even referring to the anime they are in. It makes for hilarious fun. 

My only real complaint is the ending, as I felt it was a little rushed and felt too open-ended but that is up to interpretation. 


Art: 9/10

Sound: 9/10

Both were great. Seeing the anime on Netflix really complimented it as I was able to watch it in 1080 quality. The colours popped out more than they ever have.

The music was as beautiful as I remember, using grand orchestra scores. I watched the english version and must say it is my preferred version. The voice acting was superb, with special mention to Vic Mignogna who was fantastic as Tamaki Suou. It is another great stand out performance by the same man who voiced both Dark Mousy of DNAngel and Edward Elric of the Fullmetal Alchemist series. My only complaint is the English version of the opening theme, which I just thought they could have found better singers for. 


Character: 9/10

The characters are so unique and fun that it is hard to resist them. Every character has a chance to have their back story told, even supporting characters such as Renge, the self appointed female manager of the club, and Kasanoda, someone I won't explain but whom is my favourite supporting cast member. My stand out back stories are those of the Hitachiin twins and Kyoya Ootori (the club accountant and co-founder). These individuals became so much more fascinating and lovable once you knew their past. Tamaki and Haruhi are great leads with lovable personalities. 


Enjoyment: 10/10

Overall: 8/10

Fun with the right touch of drama and heart-clenching scenes, this anime's largest flaw to me was it being cut off too short.  One particular issue made to be important is never resolved in the anime, but is discussed in greater lengths in the manga. As a HUGE fan of the manga, I would highly suggest watching the anime AND THEN  following up with the manga to complete the story, as I believe it has better progression and a more resolute and satisfying ending. If you enjoyed other typical shojo animes such as DNAngel, Special A or Toradora this is a must watch. I do believe that this anime has something for everyone, including elements that men can enjoy :) But obviously, this is generally a girl's night type of anime :P

Ouran Koukou Host Club is a great anime to cheer you up after watching a sad anime, it's funny, it has great characters and the art is really nice.
The story itself is really good. It's random and doesn't have a particular storyline that it sticks to. Most of the episodes have random stories and they're really enjoyable. It's hard to describe the story in Ouran as it's just really random and funny. 
The art is done really well. Ouran is animated by BONES and they did do an amazing job. The characters looked really well and their unique personalities shone through their looks, like theirsupposed to. There was nothing bad about the art, it was fun, creative and suited the anime. The background always looked nice and the roses always looked well. (There are a LOT of roses)


The sound was also really good. I like the opening theme, but I'm not a fan of the dubbed one. The ending theme sounds good both versions. The background music was also really good, it showed off the carefree atmosphere in the Host Club. The music never failed to fit the situation and was dramatic when it needed to be. 


The characters are what make Ouran Koukou Host Club so enjoyable, the Host Club is built surrounding the hosts personalities. 

Tamaki Suoh is the princely type,

Kyoya Ootori is the cool type,

Hikaru and Kaoru Hitachiin are the mischievous type,

Mitskuni "Honey" Haninozuka is the Boy Lolita, 

Takeshi "Mori" Morinozuka is the strong, silent type

and Haruhi Fujioka is the natural... She's just there to repay her debt.. and to eat fancy tuna..


Each character is unique in their own weird way but that's what makes Ouran so enjoyable. The other characters that pop up here and there are also great.


Ouran is amazing and has a lot of re- watch quality. I highly recommend it for everyone. It would also make a great first anime.

Rate a 10
English dubbed
Story
School so bleak and dull while at the same time informative. Thank goodness for after school groups. You have your chess team, baseball team and even a gentleman's club? No, you dirty mind individuals this clubs is meant to portray innocence and restore dignity and more importantly class. While that is ingenious idea for club what if such a event where to go where the idea of gentleman doesn't fully meet the new addition? Will the club disband? Will it improve? Will it make a difference in the characters lives? So many questions.
I personally enjoyed this show. This show i would sayis a rare gem. For not only does it excel in the genres of romance and comedy but captures a bit of every thing else. So, one could say this anime is a jack of all trades. Another aspect i like is the nice blend in gender views. Both sides are not only considered but felt by all characters. Too many shows are meant for one gender vs another given certain 'elements' but this anime all can enjoy. As long as you willing to open your mind and heart and look beyond the feminist portrayal.\n\n
Art\n
Modernly accepted art is generally what falls with in the norms. Such as is the art fully colored? was the right amount or shading or brightness applied? Was there a good balance between background and characters? Although, with this art I found had an additional feature of sparkling. Sparkling to me is when the art is grand that small elements like flowers hold the same if not more emotional/visual appearance value as gold. \n\n
Characters\n
With the idea of appearance being the high standard of this anime one will find each character has their own power. From the adorably cute childlike to the dignified intelligent. Many different forms of flowers so to type for the viewer to pick from.

Shoujo anime and manga are often considered to be a laughingstock in the otaku world. It is often criticised to be overly romantic, too idealistic or grimdark, sexist due to the useless heroine, and/or just being prime fujoshi bait.
Ouran High School Host Club takes some of these concepts and turns them on their head, while keeping the viewers interested by a good story and characters all the way through.
The story is a kind of like a cross between that of Hana Yori Dango and Hana-Kimi. A commoner girl earns a scholarship to a prestigeous academy. She stumbles upon the school's Host Club, which consists ofa group of handsome bishounen who entertain their female guests. When she accidentally knocks over an incredibly expensive vase, she is forced to join the club until she can pay for the damage... as a guy. Hilarity ensues.


The art and animation are actually quite nice. Both the OP and ED are catchy as hell, and the voice acting in both Japanese and English are superb. The characters are all believable, fun and enjoyable, and we do grow to learn a lot more about them as the series goes on. I like Haruhi especially - rather than be dense, helpless and delusioned, as many shoujo heroines tend to be, she snarks at pretty much everything around her, from the wealthy lifestyle to her wacky club members. 


I did mention that this anime deconstructs a lot of particular shoujo anime conventions, didn't I? That's where a good chunk of the humour comes from - this anime is a parody of typical shoujo anime and manga. There is even a hilarious character who is an affectionate parody of female otaku/fujoshi. 


All in all, this anime is incredibly enjoyable, and I highly recommend it if you're looking for a good comedy anime to lift your spirits.

Whether you like Anime or not, one thing I think everyone can get into is a having a good time. Who doesn't like to have fun? I sure do! And if there is one show that is a good time from beginning to end, it's Studio Bones' "Ouran High School Host Club". Hard to believe it's been almost exactly 10 years since this show finished airing, but it's hardly forgotten. Coming to us in the often criticized genre of "reverse harem" (which means a buncha guys around one girl) it destroys the barriers of it's classification and just has fun with itself.
The show's biggest strengthis it's cast of characters. Centered around a group of boys who have waaaaay too much time on their hands and choose to spend that time entertaining young ladies, they quickly grow on you and complement each other well. From the "Princely" Tamaki, to the Twins, to the too cool for school Kyouya, and the odd tag team that is the strong, silent Takashi and his boy child comic foil Mitsukuni (better known as "Honey") each has their turn in the spotlight and you get to know them as if you actually went to school together. 


The art is fantastic for what it's going for and provides so many little comedic touches and fourth wall breaks that you'll find yourself re-watching an episode to see what you missed. The Sub vs. Dub battle is a good one with my vote going to the Japanese cast. Though, it's just as enjoyable in English. Special mention goes to the always stellar Mamoru Miyano. After enjoying him so much as Light Yagami in "Death Note", it's something of an odd (yet enjoyable) twist to hear him as the goofball Tamaki. Such versatility!  


Overall, I enjoyed this Anime a great deal. It got me through a pretty tough depression and for that it will always be among my favorites. I highly recommend this to anyone in the mood for a good laugh. 8/10. Check it out. Cheers!

A mere review isn't going to be able to describe my utter love and adoration for the gem that is Ouran High School Host Club, but I shall try my upmost best to disseminate my love for it to you. 
I watched this anime a few months back and this was only my second anime but it is the reason why I got hooked onto this world of fictional characters. I didn't really know what I was expecting when I entered Ouran, I just remembered myself LAUGHING AND LAUGHING, and I knew I wanted and NEEDED more of whatever Ouran was offering. And even thoughit's an episodic anime, meaning every episode is a stand alone, there is something about every scene that charms your heart and lures you in, and before it, you are perpetually HOOKED to everything about Ouran. 


But of course, the best thing about Ouran is its CHARACTERS. They are precious precious and oh so dear to my heart. Unlike other reverse harems where girls become infatuated with the guys mostly due to their looks or their "personality type", like bad-boy or what not, Ouran does this magical thing where they present you with a distinct character trait for the boys in the host club, and at the start of the show as you try to register everyone's names, you sub-consciously associate each of them with a certain "mould", heck, you even just lump the twins together because they certainly do LOOK the same, and they appear to ACT the same, so perhaps they are the same? YOU CAN'T BE MORE WRONG. And Ouran certainly does teach its audience a serious lesson about stereotyping and labelling. Not in the usual "this is only a façade they're putting up, their real self lies within" kind of thing, no no its much simpler yet so beautifully expressed. Ouran goes out of its way to justify why the boys are behaving in a certain way, be it because of their past, their family, the expectations that others and they themselves have placed on them. The seemingly comedic and dramatic characters at the start of the series suddenly seem to be a lot more relatable than we thought. 


If you finish Ouran without falling in love with at least one of the characters, then you sir/m'am have my respect for being the most soulless anime watcher ever. Because even the female lead is extremely likeable, a far cry from your usual weak heroine that need the saving of men. Ironically, Haruhi helps the boys out with their problems, often serving the role as the mature and smart character that she is. And that's why we (including some of the boys because this is a reverse harem after all) love her to bits! But fortunately (or unfortunately, depends on how you see it), the Ouran anime doesn't focus on romance that much because the boys are still confused over their feelings for Haruhi and so they build up something that is equally, if not more important then love, and that is friendship. And that's what makes the chemistry between the characters so incredibly fabulous, with hilarity ensuing at every other scene. (Most of which stems from the host club king and my fave, Tamaki) I guarantee Ouran will have you laughing till your insides burst out. The jokes are so funny that upon rewatching them for the umpteen time, I still myself giggling a little. 


My ouran journey was such a joy, and I kinda regret finishing the anime in a mere 2 days (I couldn't stop myself), but Ouran is so amazing that I've rewatched it twice now, with each time etching new scenes into my head and heart forever. 


This "review" isn't even really a review, but rather my experience with Ouran, my favourite anime. I really do hope you will enjoy it as much as I did.

Ouran High School Host Club Review (NO SPOILERS)
As much as I love anime, I tend to be VERY late to the party, with a lot of shows. It mainly has to do with me not even really knowing what anime was, until like, 2011. So a lot of those LEGENDARY shows that are an absolute necessity to watch, I've either only recently seen them, or are still planning to do so. One of these shows... is Ouran High School Host Club.
I had heard about this show, in the past. But I didn't really pay it much mind, because it didn't really seem like my thing.But man, do people rave about this series!. At first, I was just like "Is it a fan service show?" "Is it just a girl's show?" Well, I'm very ashamed in myself for thinking those things. Because after all the different types of anime that I've seen, there is one lesson I've learned that is VERY clear. That lesson is this: In anime... there is NO SUCH THING as a "boy's show" or a "girl's show". Not. At. All. Anime is for everyone. It doesn't fear taking risks and breaking molds and boundaries. Absolutely everyone can get something out of some sort of anime. There's something for everyone, out there. And if a certain anime isn't for you, it'll never be for a reason as trivial as it being "too girly". So let's stop beating around the bush and talk about this show. First off, is this show worth all the hype that it's gotten? I'll answer that right now. Yes. Absolutely, 100% yes. 


I seriously cannot stress enough how near perfect this show is. From Episode 1, I am immediately drawn in with the entire world and its characters. And there are a lot of shows in this genre that I very much enjoy. But there's always at least one or two episodes that I don't like watching. Ouran doesn't have that. I thoroughly enjoyed each and every single episode. Each one has both hilarity that never gets old, as well as deep and engaging character development. That's where this show really shines. Its characters. They are SOOOOOOO deep! You're never done learning about them and you end up loving them, with every single passing moment. They're not perfect people. But they have very admirable qualities that often surprise you. They also go through a lot of growth and understanding of other people's feelings. I was not expecting that, from this show. Whenever an episode would come up, where the topic would be to make fun of a certain thing, usually a person's appearance or personality. At first, I would be a bit turned off, thinking the whole episode would just be making fun of these sort of things that I've had personal experience with, just because some sorts of people think it's funny. But as the episode progressed, you saw that some of the characters didn't go along with those sorts of performances. They'd actually speak up and make others aware of how some of these "jokes" can be quite hurtful. And when it comes from characters that you think would just be one dimensional boy toys, it's really powerful, seeing just how unpredictable these people are.


Tamaki was probably my favorite one, out of the bunch. He could've easily had a constantly bratty and demanding personality, who never cared or even noticed when they were hurting others. But in as early as the first episode, they show you that he isn't that kind of a person. He has a conscience. A DEEP one. He cares very deeply for his friends and for common courtesy and respectful behavior, towards other people. I think the right word would be... impressed. This show, and its characters, very much impressed me, with just how deep and civil they all were. And the whole cast is like that. Ya, all of them have that one defining trait. But they all have stories and emotion and shifting feelings. This is honestly one of the deepest and most enjoyable cast of characters I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. The ONLY character I didn't like in this show, as well as the only THING I didn't like about this show, overall, was Renge. I thought she'd just be a "one episode only" character, but she wound up being a recurring one, for reasons I still don't quite understand. I honestly don't think she adds anything at all to the show, with her presence, past her introductory episode. And even still, the best part of that episode was when they shot her down, for her less than pleasurable ideals. She's the one and only complaint I have about this show. And honestly... that's pretty impressive.


The animation isn't anything mind-blowing. It doesn't look old, as it was made in 2006. And we all know how seller anime looked in 2006. I'd more so be willing to call its design stylized, rather than simple. Whether or not people would agree with me on that, I cannot say. Probably the most shocking thing about the animation is that it was done by.... Studio Bones... That's just cool, to me. I really like how anime companies don't really have all much of a set in stone style, to them. Some of them do, of course. But I'm really happy that I can look forward to being surprised, with whatever it is I'm looking at, whenever it comes to anime. A lot of people say anime all looks the same, but that can't be farther from the truth. Look at shows like Cowboy Bebop, Clannad, Attack on Titan, and Ouran, all side by side. And try telling me that all anime looks the same. Or sounds the same, for that matter. Which leads me to my next topic: Ouran's music. For the regular tracks, it's all very nice. Nothing too mind blowing, that I can remember, after the show is over, now. BUT THE OPENING! MAAAAAAAN, THE OPENING! If you don't get addicted to that opening, the SECOND you hear it, I don't know what to tell you! THAT is a good opening theme song. And so is the ending theme song, which is quite a rarity to even say!


And finally, the classic sub vs dub debate. Honestly, after hearing how much praise was sung about this show, by the english voice actors and its fans, I absolutely had to go with the dub, on this one. And it is by far one of the best dubs I've heard. The only voice I had a problem with was with, big surprise, Renge. I don't know, it may just be because I'm use to hearing that voice attached to much younger girls, like Amy from Case Closed or May Chang from Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood. But whatever. It's a minor nitpick. That Japanese is pretty spot on, too. And this show does have a lot of Japanese text that pops on the screen, throughout each episode. It's all just a bunch of titles, along with some flavor text. None of it is necessary to read, but I would've liked if they had edited it, for the English release. It's really not a big deal though, trust me. The Japanese did a great job, but seriously. The English voice cast NAILED this one. And they LOVE this show, just as much as its fans do. So seriously. For this show, dub. All the way.


I honestly wish I did a full, in depth review on every single episode. Every one of them has merit, in both surprising you with its characters and engaging you with its story and lessons. I absolutely ADORED this show, from beginning to end. My only worry now, is that any slice of life show I watch after this won't be able to top it. But if there's one thing anime is good at, it's surprising people. So I'm excited for what the future holds, for my viewing pleasure. And I very happy, in the hear and now, for getting to meet and experience some of the greatest characters in any anime, I've seen. This show is a masterpiece. There's no other way of putting it. I can 100% recommend it to anyone and everyone. Whether it's to surprise you with something you haven't seen before. Or to just make you feel good, with the kindness and friendly characters this show has to offer. This show came to me at a very good time. It helped me feel good about life, and friendships, in general. I feel I was able to better understand some of my own friends, because of it. And I'm very grateful to this show, for that.


Ouran High School Host Club... gets a 9/10

This show is a blast right from the first line. With the narrator's sarcasm and the main character being the equivalent of a Disney character bewildered by all the singing, you have 26 episodes of adorable rose petal strewn fun.
This series knows what it is, and behaves like a Lifetime movie that laughs at itself.
The story isn't all that plot driven, it focuses on developing the characters and displaying their antics. It has a ton of cute fluff and humor, ridiculous rich boys and a down to earth girl navigating high school and this fun little playground they have created.
The art isn't the ABSOLUTE BESTI've ever seen, but I personally did like it, and it served its purpose. It was soft, fluttery, and shoujo-esque, with a pretty, flowery color scheme. The scenery never looked awkward and CGI like some sceneries look. 


The sound is pretty much the same as the art in my opinion. It had a really cute opening, that gets you singing along pretty fast. It's flowery, pretty, and buttercream icing-y.


The characters were probably my absolute favorite part of the show. Starting out as hilarious overblown stereotypes of their own doing, through their adventures, interactions with Haruhi and each other, they begin to relearn themselves and become better people. Their sometimes-clashing personalities and sometimes-idiocy makes for some humorous and really sweet developments.


Overall, I loved this show. It made me laugh, cry, ooh and ahh, and was an easy show to sit back and enjoy some popcorn with.


If you're looking for fluffy fun with cute characters and some Flynn Ryder-esque confusion over Tamaki's (Rapunzel's) antics, you're in for a treat.


Final score: 10/10 for enjoyment, 4/5 stars for quality.

I would highly recommend this anime to anyone who just wants to chill and have a few laughs. The one thing that made this anime so great to me was the character designs and how they interact with each other. Although at times they are just annoyingly ignorant of their feelings. Like in the whole series not one of them realized they like Haru;-;.
The plot of the story is pretty great, with the development of Haru as she realizes studying is not all there is t life and getting to know the club and it’s members (while gaining a few girls&guys along the way) andi especially love the “fight” the twins had, just so funny and way over exaggerated lol.

Aging is an interesting thing. 
I first watched this anime when I was in my mid-20s. You should try it when you get older. Go back and watch something you thought you really liked a decade later. See if it still holds up. I went back and watched Inuyasha (still love it, by the way), and I hated Miroku this time, when I used to love him. As we progress as a culture and race, some characters and animes just don't hold up.
Anyway, I digress.
As a 30-something Olivia watching Ouran High School Host Club, I found it SILLY. And not even in the fun andfunny way. It's silly in the roll your eyes and sigh way. 


As I watched each episode, I could actually FEEL the valuable time I was wasting and could likely be doing something else with. I didn't even make it all the way through--about half way was enough. 


I'll keep it short. All the characters (except for Haruhi) are so incredibly self absorbed that I found it really difficult to focus on anything else after a while. Everyone was SO selfish--and it wasn't funny! Was it supposed to be funny? Twenty-something Olivia found this funny. I  have no clue as to why. A bunch of completely self-absorbed pretty boys forcing a young woman to take part in their ridiculous antics because of her low economic status... ha... ha ha...? There's not even any discernible plot to speak of.


Visually, lovely; Music, catchy; Funny, no. And not even in the way where it's SOOOO DUMB that it actually does make me choke a laugh at times.


Nope. Just grimacing and sighing.

I picked this out of the Netflix lineup on a whim. The title, as well as the descriptive capsule Netflix provided, weren't very promising, yet it was still highly rated, so I figured, "What the hell; I'll check it out."
I almost immediately regretted it, and almost didn't make it through the first episode; it was like watching an episode of "Three's Company" being performed by the "Three Stooges."
The characters are initially two-dimensional stereotypes. The early episode plots seem rather pedestrian.
And yet, somewhere in there things shift fairly subtly. The characters, while superficially two-dimensional, start to show hidden depths of character. The plots, seemingly without purposeor reason, somehow begin to have subtle relevance to the hidden depths of the characters. 


In its own way, Ouran High School Host Club works on multiple levels. It presents as a straightforward pandering to certain anime stereotypes. On another, it deliciously skewers and playfully mocks those self same stereotypes.


And on yet another, it almost completely deconstructs those stereotypes, showing us a group of young friends, seemingly "On Top Of The World" and quite at ease with their wealth and privilege, who set out to playfully "Host" at their high school.


Yet each has their own emotional problems and hangups that are, somehow, seemingly relatable, as seen through the eyes of "everyday commoner girl" and audience surrogate Haruhi Fujioka. 


By the end of the series, I was no longer seeing ANY of the characters as mere stereotypes, and was instead rooting for them as individuals as they each in turn confronted and overcame personal and familial obstacles, and watched fondly as they learned that instead of being mere cordial acquaintances, they were all fire-forged friends, closer in many cases than family. 


Give it a shot, and stick with it through the earlier episodes. The payoff is worth it.

Raise your hand if you put off watching this anime because you didn't think you'd like it, but ended up loving it a whole lot!
Let's get the bad stuff over with first. Art style? Nah, not my thing. One of the biggest reasons I didn't watch this right away (because I knew it was supposed to be good) was because I cannot stand watching art styles that make me cringe. I'm very picky. There's a line I have, and Host Club was pushing it. Other than the art, I kind of felt like this anime was a slow starter. Most anime like this are becausethey have to spend some time setting up the premise and establishing everybody's personalities and relationships, but either way, this anime took a hot minute to get into. Beyond that, some of the episodes felt sort of disconnected. Most didn't, but every once in a while, I'd be like, "why is this episode here?" 


Okay, that's all the bad. Essentially, it was just a bit boring to begin with until I came to love the characters. Let me tell you, it didn't take long. The way these characters are written, it's like they're addictive. A big culprit of that is the astounding voice actors. Miyano Mamoru, especially, gave such life to his character. We all know he's amazing as a seiyuu, but this role specifically was something special. Before I knew it, I was hooked on them, and I wanted to know everything I could about their pasts.


That gives me a good opportunity to start talking about the story because these characters' depth is amazing. It's definitely not something you'd call "realistic" as this anime is definitely... Well, let's just say it's in a genre of it's own. However, once you enter the world, the story that's told through these people is actually quite intense at times. So, once you start getting to know who the characters are and how that affects their attitudes in the present, the story gets really interesting.


Honestly, if you're thinking about watching this anime, just do it. In my opinion, it's worth the hype. At the same time, I do feel like you're going to love it or hate it, but the chances are pretty good that you're gonna love it. If nothing else, I'm glad I can say I've ticked this classic off of my "to watch" list. 


Now, on to the manga.

Ouran Koukou Host Club is my first harem anime, and i loved it.

Every episode is a new has a new plot, and has start, development, an ending. It can be about love, just comedy, or interaction of the members. Some episodes make you think further: about life and relationships.
Also, Haruhi is a magnificent character, well build, theother members too. Kyouya is my favorite character, get to know him watching the anime <3\n\n
the single problem of the anime is the girl that manages (can't remember in what episode she first appears) the club, her voice is annoying and i really can't stand her.\n

Ouran was one of the first harem anime I watched and back then I loved it but now re watching it , it doesn't seem that great . The story is very average nothing special , the first 10 episodes of the series were pretty good but after that it doesn't seen that good . Sometimes this show is just cringy to watch . Now there are two thing which I loved about this show and still do . Number one being the comedy , specially with the two twins, another thing I still love is the character of Kyoya , the creators did agood job building his character and personality . There's really no error in this anime. Perhaps occasionally, it can be somewhat repetitive, but the comedy never gets tiring. This show had me staying up late to watch it, trying desperately to hold back my constant giggling as to not awaken my parents.
The story isn't what makes Ouran High School Host Club shine... It's the characters. This is probably the only anime (or one of the only ones) that combines comedy and drama perfectly. You'd think you couldn't have a little touching moment in a comedy? Think again. The elements of this anime are combined so smoothly and perfectly.
Some of the characters develop quitea bit through the course of the show, while others take only small steps in the direction of change. Some have somewhat difficult back-stories, others not as much. The series was altogether enjoyable in every prospect, but those final two episodes were amazing. \n\n
If anyone can glue together drama and comedy so perfectly without leaving any gaps or troubles between the two sides, it's the creator of Ouran High School Host Club. It may not be for everyone, but it worked well for me, and I'd recommend this anime to anyone who loves good comedy with gorgeous character development.

I love this anime, it was awesome with brilliant characters especially Tamaki. The adventures in each episode were both hilarious and serious with more being revealed about each character. Very well written and acted.
I WANT MORE EPISODES!!!!

A fabulous work of art, with outstanding screen graphics and impeccably genius drawn characters with different personalities or stereotypes. 
This is one of the best reverse harem animes I've ever watched that truly provides ground breaking humor. 
Tamaki, a narcissistic prince, Kyouya a somewhat double faced smart ass, Honey small but terrible, Mori I don't really know ho to describe him, silent?, and of course my own personal favorite the devious twins that never failed to make me laugh out loud once I see them flaunting with each other. 
Ouran High School Host Club, is a masterpiece in ever sense of the word.

Shoot, man. This was the first anime I ever watched. I picked quite a doozy didn't I?
It's hard to not love this show. It's founded on anime/high school stereotypes, yet each character has a bit more depth to them than previously anticipated. Plus it tastefully handles gender issues as well, without overstepping too many boundaries.
Also, this show is downright hilarious. It could be called Hijinks: the Show. There are many goofy moments that will have you giggling at how lovable and silly some of these people are - especially the head of the Host Club. And yet, the show dares to try and have somemore emotional parts. In other shows that would be a complete failure, but in this case, it somehow works. Perhaps it's due to good storytelling and character development, or perhaps the makers just got lucky. Whatever the case, I own the full show on dvd and I'm not sorry at all.

I've just finished this anime and I love it!! Innovation in manga's world!
Excellent anime: fun, fun, FUN! If you want to have a very good time watching anime and NON STOP laughing, you must see it^^
The characters development is so great and i think it is well structured in the ''story line''. It's very interesting to see how all them grow up as the anime goes on.
Although this is a comedy anime, there are really drama moments that let you see the real characters' soul. It's so touching.
I have watched a lot of animes and this one is totally in my top 10 of ''animesI have enjoyed most'' and in my top 5 of ''funniest animes''.\n\n
But I want a second part of this anime! I need to watch mooore...xD Well, I guess I have to read the manga to know how is going to continue!\n\n
Saludos =)\n\n
Bye =)\n\n
P.D.: sorry for my english, I hope you understand the review :)

As a lighthearted pseudo romantic comedy with sparks of emotional depth and meaning, this is a great anime across the board. Perhaps some might be too quick to designate this show as childish or haughty, but deep down it's neither. -Ok, actually it could be a little haughty with its aristocratic humor-. But that aside, the art and the characters alone make this a great series, and the story keeps things lighthearted and fun, with occasional moments of beautiful honesty and emotion. 
Art: I loved how emotions were portrayed with quick cuts to dramatic and over-the-top illustrations, perfectly timed with a musical crescendo. This stylereally shows why anime is such a unique and special form of artistic expression. 


Character: The characters have been well thought out, each of them unique to not only one another, but to anime characters in general. This is really a unique cast of characters. I found them all likable, and their back story intriguing. 


Story: The show doesn't go for any grandiose narrative, many of the episodes involve trivial objectives, which become all the more exciting because of the melodramatic nature of the cast. However there is a plot that slowly unfolds and ultimately adds meaning to the overall story. Really what I liked was that I could enjoy any scene, regardless of the plot, simply  because the artistry was incredible, and the characters were so uniquely entertaining. As the title implies, you really do learn a thing or two about being a great host.

I didn't like it. Because it seemed very boring. It wasn't funny, it wasn't entertaining, it was lame. Haruhi is a mary-sue, and I hate "hawt animu guys". 
The characters are horrible. I hate them. Most of them are "HAWT ANIMU GUYS" another ones are boring supporting characters.
Another thing, is that why do women dress with long dresses? Isn't it the 21st century? And also there's the boring stereotype where girls are prissy princesses waiting for their princesses. ._.
3/10

Alright! 
As a girl who does not like shoujo anime/manga...it is very hard for me to even bring myself to watching one from this genre; even so when it is labelled with HAREM!!! I just really don't like harem...original or reversed -I dislike BOTH.
However, OHSHC by my opinion should not be tagged with that genre...and it is by far my most favourite shoujo anime/manga EVER! From the great characters to facepalm-at-rich-snobby-brats moments, I adore this anime.
Story|
I deduct a point from the story since...it gets a little predictable at a certain point but that does not mean I didn't find it hilarious~ The basic summary ofthe whole story is how Fujioka Haruhi leads her life as a normal 'commoner' in the world of the 6 rambunctious and good-looking princes and falls for one of them. What I like about this anime so much is that despite being surrounded by 6 rich guys, it does not focus on how each guy falls for her unlike other harem-based animes. Sure there are a couple of them who falls for her but the main focus is on the main pair instead of having the one heroine receiving endless love from multiple guys. It's realistic to have at least one or two guys falling for one girl but when it exceeds that number, that's the part where I'd just push the anime far far from my sights. \n
Okay, enough about the harem-rant...I find story overall ridiculously humorous with bits and pieces of drama that I can accept. However, the main focal point that sets the story in its place of originality is definitely the characters which I'll talk about later but as of now, I love the story so 9/10~\n\n
Art & Sound |\n
I'll just talk about both of these in one paragraph...\n
The art is not mindbogglingly amazing, but not at all bad in any way. I find the art style to be very light-hearted and it matches with the whole romantic-comedy feel of the anime. The settings can sometimes be very well done which I find that there is still effort to the art of this anime. What I find most to my liking is how the art never contradicts the emotion of the moment; when it is serious, it doesn't clash with the seriousness and when it's comedic, it goes with the whole humorous flow~ I can't really say much but despite being VERY picky towards the art-style of an anime, I like OHSHC's just fine...\n
The sound...well, the opening is very addictive... I mean, REALLY ADDICTIVE. I find myself singing along to the opening instead of skipping it as I always do with other animes... I like it that much..haha! I think the OST fits pretty well with the anime and the whole 'royal' sounding music makes the rich guys sound more and more like princes instead of just sons and heirs of a rich family. I do appreciate the music to really bring the comedic moments to life because...I just think that the background music explains a certain emotion best so it did well by my opinion~ So overall for both areas, I give them 7/10.\n\n
Character |\n
Oh~ my most favourite part of this anime~\n
I don't even have to explain to how PERFECT Mamoru Miyano voiced Tamaki~ It's biased I know but I just adore how he always catches the personality of his character and brings them to life and in this case, Tamaki is probably the light of the whole anime...it's lovely to see how the 'King' of the club is the one being bullied and have pranks pulled upon him; yet, he maintains his status by showing consideration and affection for not only the heroine, but his club members as well.\n
Now, I don't mind when an anime focuses totally on the main pair; I mean...it's a shoujo anime... DUH. But this is why OHSHC is such an irresistable anime...not only do we get to appreciate the main pair's developing relationship but also the other character's growth as well; AND, they do not depend on the main girl to have their own development. In some episode, Haruhi barely does anything and instead, the story focuses on a certain character. I find this to be very refreshing and realistic because...come on...why on earth would 6 guys need one girl to have a change in their lives right?\n
So yeah...nothing more to say~ 10/10~!\n\n
By now, you probably can tell that I really enjoyed this anime and YES. I do. I can re-watch this anime forever and never get bored of it...hahaha! I think I've re-watched this anime completely for about 8 times and as I'm writing this review, I feel like re-watching it again so THAT'S how much I enjoyed it! 9/10 for enjoyment and overall, I think this is a shoujo anime that stands out on its own in this genre. So do give it a try and be amazed by all its ridiculous humour and face-palming moments...I know I did~ ^_^

This anime is about an average girl who gets a scholarship into a prestige school for the rich, and on her first day she isn't dress in the normal school attire, and because of her short hair, when bumping into a group of Host Club boys, they all mistaken her for being a guy.
Knowing that she didn't belong, she tried to leave accidently breaking a very expensive vase, which causes her to now work in the host club.
Even though this anime has the genre shoujo listed, it can be watched by all. It has very good comedy and the character design intergrated with the storymakes it a very good anime to watch. If you are person who likes to watch comedy romance animes, this is recommended.

When I watched the first few episodes I was mildly impressed. It was quite enjoyable and funny but I didn’t like it that much. So I dropped it. After a few months I picked it up again and I’m so glad I did. I realised the first few eps were just a very long introduction. After the introduction I was SO amazed and impressed! The art is very nice – although noses are too sharp for my preference – the characters are all unique and throughout the whole anime, the watcher gets to know each character very well. It’s EXTREMELY cute and quite hilarious! Itwas a good break from all the dramatic, hardcore stuff I finished reading. It’s not long making it more enjoyable. It’s one of those animes where you feel satisfied but you still wish there was a season 2. 


I highly recommend people to try this, although it may not suit some people, it really is quite entertaining and features a little bit of many things – romance, comedy, drama. It’s perfect for a break from hardcore stuff and you finish it with a warm, happy feeling inside. SUGOI!

I'll just give a simple but solid review~ Ouran is an anime that will absolutely give you what are rom-com actually is. It has the comedy that totally will thrill you.  If you are looking for anime that will relax you and enjoy you then Ouran is the right choice! The development of the characters, the romance, the comedy all of it is in a package that will not disappoint you!

Ouran High School Host Club is a 26 episode shojo anime aired in 2006. It was directed by Takuya Igarashi and produced by the animation studio bones. 
  ~STORY~
The story of this anime is very original and refreshing. There are basically little to no plot holes, and the character backgrounds are explained quite well. The plot of the anime while commendable, it rather small, so this anime relies mostly on story. The story is never boring and though sometimes predictable, it never fails to entertain. 
~ART~
The animation was done by one of my favorite studios, Bones. The animation quality is quite spectacular. The colorsare very bright, and the animation is consistent throughout the series. The character designs are very unique and lively. One thing I also found quite good is that the backgrounds are always very detailed. Never does the animation seem bland or of poor quality. \n\n
~SOUND~\n
The music for this anime was done by Yoshihisa Hirano. While the name may not sound familiar, the music for this show is simply brilliant. The soundtrack consists of a lot of classical sound music, which fits with the elegant theme of the Host Club. The opening is also one of my personal favorites. With upbeat and catchy music, it fits quite well. I personally didn't have as much as a problem with the English dub cover of the opening as some people did, although I do prefer the original Japanese version. The ending is also quite catchy, although if I had to choose between the two I would probably pick the opening. The voice acting for this show is top notch, in both the Japanese and English versions. The voices all fit the characters well. I believe the English dub is one of Funimation's best. The actors portray their characters perfectly. \n\n
~CHARACTERS~\n
The characters are probably one of the best aspects of this show. They are all original and unique in their own way, and you simply never get tired of them. I especially enjoyed the main character Haruhi, because she's very different from most shojo protagonists. Every important character gets a fair amount of screen time, and the way they interact is simply hilarious. \n\n
~ENJOYMENT~\n
Overall, I enjoyed this show immensely. I was never bored watching it, and I found myself craving more at the end of every episode. Thus, I was quite disappointed when I finished the last episode. \n\n
~OVERALL~\n
I give this anime an easy 10 out of 10. If you've looked at my profile, it's quite easy to tell this is my favorite anime series ever. It's done very well in every aspect, and I recommend it to everyone, even those who don't enjoy shojo.

This is rather an unusual anime for me. Typically, I would have a particular delightment for deep psychological and philosophical anime with blood, morbid, gore and violence but this is quite an exquisite piece of literature. 
Story (9/10)
The story was quite exaggerated which gives it its own unique style but at the same time it will give you moments where it will pull your heartstrings. The mixture of over the top and stereotypical comedy, friendship and serious heart throbbing moments were in unmarred harmony. If there is something problematic with the story, then it’s the annoying uncalled for scenes of an annoying character. 
Art (8/10)
Thecharacter designs are not that original but the only thing good about the art is their overwrought shots of some kind of girlish fantasy that well-suited the story and the characters personality.  


Sound (9/10)


Firstly, when I first heard the intro, my head assumed that this is a typical girly girl romance; one girl and six other guys fighting over her, henceforth, it sends some confusing message to the viewers, perhaps to attract more viewers who are very drawn to this kind phenomenon? But in the end, the song has a catchy feel to it. Other than that, the music within the show itself perfectly depicts a stereotypical high-class person wherein in history are the handful of people who are able to afford seats in a theater house to watch dramas and operas. The sound effects and background music were well-picked and were in sync with a specific scene.


Character (10/10)


The characters are the driving force of the story. Their personalities where very much differentiated and still stick to its theme of an exaggerated stereotypical anime. It is also rather ironic for the characters themselves explain some of the stereotypes done within the show. In the end, the exaggerated stereotypical characters went into full bloom and demonstrated another side which caused a more dramatic and near serious scenery; from a typical cool analytic nerd to a perv-like persona, from a narcissist to a person with a big sharing heart, from a mischievous personality to a deep wounded heart, from fiercesome martial arts master to an innocent child.  


*Overall, the anime is worth watching and beautifully pieced together. After watching something dark or perhaps serious, this is something that will help loosen up a twisted mind.
