♡ "Kiss Kiss Fall In Love" ♡ 
When I first stumbled upon this anime, I thought that this anime was just the stereotypical love story where the popular boy falls in love with a shaggy, unpopular girl. It sort of does, but this wonderful anime which follows the popular 'boy mistaken for a girl' idea stars Haruhi, a 'commoner' who winds up at the elite school with Ouran Academy due to a scholarship.
Characters and their Developments: 
The characters of this anime are very well developed despite the fact that at the beginning they are mostly set with a stereotypical sort of idea, but as youprogress through the season, you will find that there is new perky traits of each host as you come along.


For example, the 'prince' Tamaki is actually a perceptive, empathetic leader who comes off as an idiot (but there is actually more to him than meets the eye); Hikaru and Kaoru, the two, mischevious demon twins who enjoy a good prank or two who uses their 'twincest' to appeal to girls; Kyoya, the money-minded Shadow Lord who cares about profit as much as if it was life; Honey, the loli-shota obsessed with his sweets, and his loyal friend, Mori, the silent stoic type. Haruhi herself is more of the bookish type and is immune to the host's charms, yet becomes entangled (in a very light) love triangle, which is vaguely resolved in the end of the series. 


It's easy to relate to and you will find (just like I did) that you will fall in love with pretty much all the characters and not just one.



Art:


The art is just impeccable - the creators didn't go over the top with what they were doing, mixing the rich and royal and balancing the norm just right! I don't understand why some people would dislike the animations - they do look much different from the way that they were drawn in the manga - but to me (personally) I found that they looked much better!



Enjoyment:


I absolutely adored it! It didn't concetrate so much on the romantic side of things that I would feel stuffed and feel like switching off the tv screen. If you don't particurlarly enjoy romance too much like I do, you don't need to worry about that in this anime! OHSHC mostly focuses on the comedic sides of things, and I found myself laughing my head off in the most inappropriate of times (like at midnight when I wasn't supposed to be up.)


Recommendations:


I would recommend this to pre teens or early teens like ( from 12 up, preferably 13). It seems like a show more aimed for girls but I gave it for my guy friends to watch and they loved it, so hey! Lets not be stereotypical! I personally read the manga and I found that it followed the plot quite well, but skipped a lot of parts, but still overall made a great impression on me. OHSHC is actually one of my top animes and one of my first.

Hilarious.  It was always exciting to go on to the next episode.  The characters are well-formed and are great foils to each other.  It has a great balance of light-hearted humor and deep-soul drama. High rewatchablility.

Its amazing how all the people in the anime have there own storys that go together with everything, and how tammaki is the one thing that ceaps them all together. Its amamzing how this anime trully speaks from the hearts, and shows that you schould never judge a book by its cover! If you love anime that ceaps you on your seat and makes you cry at the same time with happiness then this is trully a anime for you!

Ah~ Ouran High School Host Club one of my first anime and my introduction to the bi-shoujo genre well does it hold up?
Yes unlike some other bi-shoujo anime of that time it goes against the stereotypes you would typically see in these shows
the female protagonist? she is mistaken for a boy and doesn't really care about romance much at all she is a smart independent woman 
the bishonen boys?  they are not eye candy they actually have personalities outside of their pretty face's Tamaki is a arrogant but friendly man even and while they are rich they aren't the typical pompus snobs rich peopleare shown as in most media

they actually welcome haruhi (a commoner) into their club


since some of the people behind this show worked on cardcaptor sakura

of course it would carry over some of the great animation,story and character 


There's even some 4th wall jokes in there which not only makes fun of the show itself but also some of the aspects of shojo anime  like the fan girls,the over the top visuals and acting and even radical feminists a.k.a the zuka club 


Sound wise the voice actors and actresses are excellent and know how to balance over the top acting with true emotional realistic acting 


and even though the opening Sakura Kiss and Ending Shissou sound like typical J Pop music from this genre there's also some very beautiful classical music pieces in the OST it sounds like a melody from Princess tutu with how wonderfully composed the background music is 


the only flaws I can see in the show

is with some characters like Eclair and Kyoya's dad also some of the fan service can be a bit too much though it's not the worst fan service I've seen from these types of shows 


in conclusion I think Ouran is a great show with great Characters,Animation 

a beautiful OST and some of the best voice acting in anime

Ouran High School Host Club is another add-on to the romantic comedy genre of anime, but unlike many others, this takes a bit of a different approach. Instead of "finding true love" as many romantic stories have in mind, this anime centers on a girl having to do chores for a guy club after accidentally stumbling upon them. 
PROS
The animation in Ouran High School Host Club is quite unique. It has pretty much every bright color you can think of. Dark colors, such as brown and black, are barely ever seen. This can be an upside or downside to the viewer, depending on what you'relooking for. I rather enjoyed the visuals, although it took some time to get used to. The cuteness factor of the show is what drags a lot of people in after the first episode. 


As said before, the story is pretty unique compared to other romance anime stories, but it isn't anything special. I guess I have to give the story credit for being as original as it is, despite my mixed feelings towards it. Originality is a key factor that I'm sure most look for in anime, and the story here, while a bit "meh", is original. 


All the characters in this anime are very interesting and unique. I feel like anyone who watches this series will target one character throughout the series that they will like the most (although all of them are likeable). For me, it was Honey because he just seemed so joyful and full of life whenever a plot centered on him. 


The comedy here is as good as a show like this can be. Lots of laughs happen throughout the series, although things get a bit more dramatic near the end, but it doesn't go off the deep end or anything. If you love to laugh, this would be the anime for you.


CONS


I can't really think of many cons to this anime. I guess I wish there were more episodes or a second season, but I'm sure that won't happen in the future. 


I scored the sound used in the anime as a 7. It isn't anything special. I mean, this is a romantic comedy. It's used the way it should be.


OVERALL


Ouran High School Host Club is an anime that you need to watch if you love cuteness and laughter. It's a unique, but at times, predictable story that is fun for whoever wants to try it out. I personally love it.

First let me start off with this may not be your type of anime but i recommend this show to everyone. If your a guy or a girl. It is full of comedy and you will grow really attached to the characters. Trust me the first time i tired to watch this show i only made it passed the opening then i turned it off and said "No way am i watching this"
A year later i decided to give it another chance and let me say it is one of my favorite animes ever! There is really no story plot but there is a storyinvolved and it all ties in together in the last two episodes. The ending was great probably my favorite. This show is really unique i love it alot.\n\n
Also for the people who dont want to watch it because they think it is a romance anime there really isnt alot of romance, only a couple episodes but they dont focus on it. So everyone give this anime a try with an open mind and im sure you wont regret it :)

Story 
 9/10
Haruhi Fujioka is a scholarship student at the prestigious Ouran Academy, a fictitious high school located in Bunkyo, Tokyo. Looking for a quiet place to study, Haruhi stumbles upon the Third Music Room, a place where the Ouran Academy Host Club, a group of six male students, gathers to entertain female "clients". During their first meeting, Haruhi accidentally knocks over and breaks an antique vase valued at ¥8,000,000 (US$80,000 in the U.S. English manga)[1] and is told to repay the cost in service to the club. Haruhi's short hair, slouching attire and gender-ambiguous face cause her to be mistaken by the hosts fora male student. The hosts all agree that Haruhi would be a good host, thus making her join the host club. Ultimately she agrees to join the Club as a host herself (dressed as a male) in order to pay off her debt.[2] She agrees to join since she does not mind hosting as long as she can pay the debt off faster. The hosts do later find out that she is, in fact, a girl. They keep this a secret, so no one will be able to tell. The Ouran Private Academy encompasses kindergarten to twelfth grade (along with a university). Most students come from wealthy families, but in special cases, merit scholarships are granted to exceptional students from a lower income bracket. The school's unofficial motto is "Lineage counts first, wealth a close second," meaning students with stellar family backgrounds but low socioeconomic status may be given top priority over those from rich families with lesser pedigrees. 



*Copied from Wikipedia 



The story is very unique and special. I actually started watching this Anime only because it was so different from any other Harem Anime. 

I love the story line and how each character evolves as the story progresses. 



Animation 

 9/10


It suits the anime. It's simple no overly extreme. It has a touch of humor to it and so it's nice to watch.


Sound 

 9/10


Really good sound effects. Suits the mood and contributes to the overall charm of the Anime.


Characters 

 9.5/10


Haruhi is supposed to be the 'natural charmer'in the host club. Which is really funny she she is actually a girl and other girls are charmed by her. 


The other members of the club consist of the president Tamaki Suou, a student who treats Haruhi like she is his own daughter and is hugely jealous of anyone else who approaches her; Kyoya Otori, the bespectacled calculating vice-president who serves as the brains of the club; Hikaru and Kaoru Hitachiin, a pair of mischievous identical twins who like playing tricks on the other club members and playing up a homoerotic angle on their relationship; Mitsukuni "Honey" Haninozuka ("Hunny" in the manga), a small, cute boy who has a great passion for stuffed animals and eating cakes; and Takashi "Mori" Morinozuka, a tall, quiet boy who is protective of Honey. All the characters are parodies of shojo manga characters, with Haruhi serving as the "natural" type, Tamaki as the "princely" type, Kyoya as the "cool" type, the Hitachiin twins as the "little devils", Honey as the "cute shotacon" type, and Mori as the "strong, silent type". 



The characters are really very good. They were able to take different genres of manga and make characters out of them which I liked. 

Each character had some hidden past that shaped the way they turned out to be. 

I liked how they were able to help each other overcome their problems and finally become something that resembled a family.


Overall 

 9.5/10


I thought this Anime is pretty good if you just want to relax and have some fun.I especially like that the motto of the Host Club is aimed at making the customers who come there happy. 

It's a touching anime and will make you a kinder person after watching it. 


Loved the ending, it had a sense of completeness and you feel a great deal of satisfaction after finishing it.

This anime is one that I can watch over and over again and not ever get bored. I watch it on Netflix all the time. 
But lets talk about why shall we? 
The story: 9/10
The story follows Haruhi Fujioka, a first year at Ouran Academy. After making it there on a full scholarship, Haruhi's goals are to be a lawyer much like their late mother. However, while looking for a quiet place to study, Haruhi stumbles upon the Ouran Host Club, and also stumbles upon a very expensive vase, shattering it into pieces and is thrown into an 8 million yen debt. Now, Haruhi mustwoo over one thousand girls to pay back the debt. However, Haruhi is actually a girl herself! This quirky school comedy follows the struggles of each member of the infamous Ouran Host Club. 


The story is pretty solid. It's unique, and fun. It kind of set the bar for school stories. That's probably why I enjoy it so much. 


Art and Sound: Both 9/10. 

The art is unique and a lot of fun. The artists really had a blast drawing each scene and you could tell. Funimation and the Japanese seiyuus also give these characters distinct voices and personalities. I'm a dub fan in anime, but the sub is undeniably good as well. 


Characters: 10/10

These characters are so good. Being a reverse harem, you would figure Haruhi's character is just there as a place holder for the viewer to place themselves in, giving them the ability to be with any character of their choosing. This usually means the female lead is bland or boring. Haruhi however is not. She's independent, to the point where she has very limited social skills, she's smart, she's beautiful, and she sticks up for her friends and those she believes in. 


The male cast around her is good as well. They are not just some pretty faces. The anime does a good job diving into each characters past and psyches. You see each one grow with the help of Haruhi's non-bias and motherly guidance. Not only that, but they boys help out Haruhi. They teach her how to be social again, and how to depend on others. 


The side characters are good too. They all have episodes dedicated to their stories and you feel for each one, wanting them to succeed. 


It truly is a great cast of characters. 


This anime is beautiful. It's funny, it's sad, it's heartwarming. Sure, the last two episodes stray from the manga, but that only encourages people to go READ the manga. 


Everyone should watch this. It's a great gateway into anime, and it's just a lot of fun.
